docs.title: Match Official System Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Match Official System user guide. Whether you're a match official tracking your development, a reviewer providing feedback, or an administrator managing your organisation, this documentation will help you get the most out of the system.

docs.title: What You Can Do
docs.text:
The Match Official System is a comprehensive platform designed to support professional development and performance management for match officials and related personnel.

Track Your Development Create and manage diary entries to record daily observations, match assessments, and personal development goals. Request feedback from reviewers and track your progress over time with seasonal reviews and performance analytics.

Manage Assessments & Exams Complete online exams with secure question banks, receive detailed feedback on your performance, and monitor your assessment history. Reviewers can provide structured feedback using customised rating scales and comment fields.

Collaborate & Communicate Access news and announcements from your organisation, upload and share files through a centralised library, and connect with colleagues by searching the user directory.

Administer Your Organisation Configure how your group uses the system by setting up assessment templates, managing user access levels, creating competitions, and analysing group performance through detailed reporting dashboards.

docs.title: Roles and Access
docs.text:
• Administrator/Owner: Highest association admin role. Can manage members, groups, and system settings.
  • Reviewer: Elevated user who can assess or review content for others (exact permissions vary by page).
  • Member/User: Standard account with access to member-facing features.
  • Admin Level: Numeric access level stored in session (e.g., 0 = user, 1+ = admin; certain features require 3+). Determines access to admin pages and controls.

docs.title: Organizations and Groups
docs.text:
• Group/Association: Your primary organisation within MOS. Many features (News, Reports, Assessments) are scoped to an association.
  • Subgroup: A subdivision within an association used for targeting (e.g., region, squad, team). Membership in subgroups controls visibility of targeted content like News.

docs.title: Assessments and Performance
docs.text:
• Assessment: A review or evaluation of match official performance created by reviewers based on match observations.
  • Diary Entry: A personal record of a match created by an official. Contains observations and self-reflection.
  • Plan: A development or training plan. Includes goals, actions, and timeframes.
  • Assessments: Evaluations such as exams or reviews completed by members within the system.

docs.title: Content and Communication
docs.text:
• News: Articles posted by admins for the association and its subgroups. Sorted by last updated; paged with a Show more button.
  • Email-to-News: Sending an email to a designated mailbox (shown on the News page for admins) to create an article. Subject is the title, body is the content, and attachments are added.

docs.title: Files and Media
docs.text:
• Attachments: Files associated with a record (e.g., News, Media). May be stored in Azure Blob Storage or local uploads, with links routed through file.aspx.
  • Media Library: Read-only browsing of media (e.g., videos, images) linked to reviews/assessments.
  • Folders (File Manager): Admin-facing area for creating, uploading, moving, and sharing files/folders.
  • Share Link: A predefined or generated URL that provides access to a file or resource, sometimes with restricted scope/time.

docs.title: System Features
docs.text:
• Sanitization: Unsafe HTML is removed before rendering to protect users. Links are preserved where possible.
  • Time-ago Display: Relative time formatting for dates (e.g., "Last updated 2 hours ago").
  • Data Storage: All data is stored securely in Microsoft Azure in the Australia Southeast region, ensuring data residency compliance.

docs.text: The Match Official System is a platform for managing match officials, assessments, training, and professional development. It provides tools for recording match diaries, receiving feedback, and communicating with your association.

docs.title: What Is the Match Official System?
docs.text:
The Match Official System helps associations and match officials work together effectively by providing:

  • Personal dashboard showing your activity and upcoming tasks
  • Assessment and diary management for match officials
  • Training plan tracking and development goals
  • News and announcements from your association
  • Document and media library for sharing resources

  • Receive feedback from reviewers

  • Provide constructive feedback

Reviewers

Same as viewers, plus:

  • Track development progress
  • Support continuous improvement

Owners

  • Publish news and announcements
  • Create and assign assessments
  • Generate reports
  • Configure association settings

For levels of access, see Levels of Access.

Access Level

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Assessment Templates allow you to customise how your users complete different types of assessments. You can configure the layout, fields, ratings, comments, and instructions for diary entries, match day assessments, season reviews, media entries, custom assessments, and peer reviews.

Each assessment type can be tailored to your organisation's specific needs with custom descriptions, detail fields, and administrative instructions.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
1. From the main menu, click Admin
  2. Click Group Settings
  3. Click the Assessment templates tab (visible after selecting Assessment templates from the sidebar)

The page shows tabs for Assessments and Plans. Assessment Templates are under the Assessments tab.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• You must have administrator access
  • Changes to templates apply to all new assessments created after the changes
  • Existing assessments keep their original template format
  • You can have up to 20 rating options and 10 comment fields per assessment type
  • All text fields support formatted text with descriptions

Template Archiving and Historical Data

When you modify a template, the previous version is automatically archived to keep historical data intact for accurate reporting. However, frequently changing templates can create many archived versions and impact data consistency.

Best practice: Design your templates carefully before implementation. Make changes sparingly to avoid breaking up your datasets for reporting. If you need a significantly different template, consider waiting until the end of season/year before changing.

docs.title: Assessments Tab
docs.text: The Assessments tab contains templates for six assessment types. Each can be customised independently.

docs.title: Diary Template
docs.text:
Diary entries are day-by-day assessments created by users.

Configure diary days:

  1. Under the Diary tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days from the dropdown
  3. Users can enter observations for each selected day

Control user access to diary features:

  1. "Allow users to request review?" - Set to Yes or No
  2. "User can see ratings section?" - Set to Yes or No
  3. "User can see comments section?" - Set to Yes or No

Configure administrator visibility:

  1. "Admin ratings section?" - Select:
  2. Yes, response shared with user - Admins can rate and users see the ratings
  3. Yes, response not shared with user - Admins can rate but users don't see them
  4. No, cannot access - Admins cannot see user responses
  5. "Admin comments section?" - Select same three options

Add descriptions for users:

  1. In the "Diary description the user sees" field, enter text that explains how to complete the diary
  2. In the "Diary description the administrator sees" field, enter guidance for admins reviewing diaries
  3. In the "Diary description the user sees when reviewed" field, enter what users see after their diary is reviewed

Add custom detail fields:

Diary entries include three hardcoded fields that are always present: - Team A - First team name - Team B - Second team name - Venue - Location of the diary entry

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Under "Details" section, you see 6 detail fields available
  2. For each detail field, enter:
  3. A field label (e.g., "Objectives achieved")
  4. Instructions for users
  5. Leave blank to hide the field
  6. Each detail field becomes a section in the diary entry form

Overall comment box for reviews:

When a diary is reviewed by an administrator or reviewer, they can enter feedback in: - Ratings section - Individual ratings for specific performance areas - Comments section - Individual comments for each comment field - Overall comment box - A free-text box for general feedback that's not tied to any specific field

Users see all admin feedback after the review is completed.

Save your changes:

  1. After all changes, click Save assessment design at the bottom
  2. Result: New diary entries show your updated template

docs.title: Match Day Template
docs.text:
Match day assessments are observations about specific matches or events.

Configure match day days:

  1. Under the Match Day tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days from the dropdown

Control ratings and comments:

  1. "Show ratings section?" - Select:
  2. Yes, response shared with user - Visible to users
  3. Yes, response not shared with user - Admin only
  4. No - Not shown
  5. "Show comments section?" - Select same three options

Add descriptions:

  1. In "Match Day description for the administrators" field, enter admin guidance
  2. In "Match Day description the user sees when submitted" field, enter what users see after submission

Add detail fields:

Match day assessments include three hardcoded fields that are always present: - Team A - First team name - Team B - Second team name - Venue - Location of the match

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Enter labels for each custom detail field
  2. Leave blank to hide a field
  3. Common examples:
  4. Detail 1: "In-game decisions"
  5. Detail 2: "Communication"
  6. Detail 3: "Positioning"
  7. Detail 4: "Game awareness"
  8. Detail 5: "Player management"
  9. Detail 6: "Overall performance"

Overall comment box for reviews:

When a match day assessment is reviewed, reviewers can enter: - Specific ratings and comments for individual fields - An overall comment box for general feedback on the match assessment

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Season Template
docs.text:
Season templates are for longer-term seasonal reviews or summaries.

Add detail fields:

  1. Enter labels and instructions for all 6 detail fields available
  2. Examples:
  3. Detail 1: Seasonal achievements
  4. Detail 2: Areas for development
  5. Detail 3: Goals for next season
  6. Detail 4: Performance highlights
  7. Detail 5: Learning outcomes

docs.text:

docs.title: Peer Template
docs.text:
Peer assessments allow officials to review each other.

Configure peer days:

  1. Under the Peer tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days

Control ratings and comments:

  1. "Show ratings section?" - Select visibility level
  2. "Show comments section?" - Select visibility level

Add descriptions:

  1. In "Peer description for the administrators" field, enter admin guidance
  2. In "Peer description the user sees when submitted" field, enter user-facing text

Add detail fields:

Peer assessments include three hardcoded fields: - Peer name - Name of the person being reviewed - Event/Match - The event or match being assessed - Date - Date of the event

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Enter labels for each custom detail field
  2. Examples:
  3. Detail 1: "Technical competency"
  4. Detail 2: "Decision making"
  5. Detail 3: "Communication"
  6. Detail 4: "Positioning and movement"
  7. Detail 5: "Game awareness"
  8. Detail 6: "Overall feedback"

Overall comment box for peer reviews:

When a peer assessment is submitted, the reviewer can enter: - Individual ratings and comments for each field - An overall comment box for general feedback about the peer

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Plans Tab
docs.text:
The Plans tab contains templates for plan-type entries that users create for development and goal planning.

Plans follow a similar structure to assessments with customisable detail fields and comment sections. Configure plan templates in the same way as assessments by:

  1. Clicking the Plans tab at the top of the Assessment Templates page
  2. Selecting each plan type from the left sidebar
  3. Adding custom detail fields and descriptions
  4. Configuring visibility and permissions
  5. Clicking Save to apply changes

Plans are typically used for: - Development goals and planning - Performance improvement plans - Seasonal planning - Personal development objectives

docs.title: Ratings
docs.text:
Create custom rating scales used across your assessments. These appear as options when admins and users complete assessments.

View all ratings:

  1. Click the Ratings tab
  2. You see a table of all available ratings for your group

Add a new rating:

  1. In the "Add a new rating" section, enter a rating option (e.g., "Excellent", "Good", "Needs Improvement")
  2. Click Add rating
  3. The rating is available in all assessment forms

Edit a rating:

  1. Click Edit next to the rating
  2. Change the rating text
  3. Click Update

Delete a rating:

  1. Click Delete next to the rating
  2. The rating is removed from all future assessments

docs.title: Competitions
docs.text:
Create a list of competitions or events for your group. These can be referenced in assessments and reports.

View all competitions:

  1. Click the Competitions tab
  2. You see a table of all competitions

Add a new competition:

  1. In the "Add a new competition" section, enter the competition name
  2. Click Add competition
  3. The competition is available for selection in assessment entries

Edit a competition:

  1. Click Edit next to the competition
  2. Change the competition name and rest days if needed
  3. Click Update

Delete a competition:

  1. Click Delete next to the competition
  2. The competition is removed from the system

docs.title: Ratings and Comments Configuration
docs.text:
Each assessment type can have customised rating scales and comment fields. These are configured separately for each assessment type.

For Diary assessments:

  1. Scroll to the Diary template section
  2. You see 20 rating options (Rating 1 through Rating 20)
  3. For each rating option, enter the rating label (e.g., "Positioning", "Decision making", "Communication")
  4. Below the ratings, enter 10 comment field labels (Comment 1 through Comment 10)
  5. For each comment field, enter a label and description
  6. Examples:
  7. Comment 1: Strengths
  8. Comment 2: Areas for improvement
  9. Comment 3: Development goals

Apply the same process for:

  • Match Day assessments (ratings and comments)
  • Other assessment types that support ratings and comments

Save all changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design at the bottom of the page
  2. Result: Your custom ratings and comments appear in all new assessments

docs.title: Create a custom diary template for your organisation
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the Assessments tab, then Diary

  4. Enable ratings and comments for both users and admins

  6. Enter admin description: "Review the diary entry and provide constructive feedback using the ratings and comments sections"

docs.title: Assessment Template Fields
docs.text:
Number of days on the entry

  • Determines how many day sections users see (1-5 days)
  • Each day has a separate text entry area

Allow users to request review (Diary only)

User can see ratings section

docs.title: Changes to assessment template not appearing
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You modified a template but existing assessments don't show changes
  • New assessments show old format

How to fix

  1. Go back to Assessment Templates
  2. Verify you clicked Save assessment design
  3. Clear your browser cache
  4. Create a new assessment and check if the template applied
  5. Existing assessments keep their original format; only new ones use updated templates

Common causes

  • Forgot to save changes
  • Browser cache showing old version
  • Changes apply only to new assessments, not existing ones

docs.title: Rating not appearing in assessment form
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You added a rating but users don't see it
  • Rating selection dropdown is missing

How to fix

  1. Go to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the Ratings tab
  3. Verify the rating appears in the table
  4. If missing, add it again by entering the rating name and clicking Add rating
  5. Go back to the assessment form and refresh the page

Common causes

  • Rating wasn't saved
  • Browser cache issue

docs.title: Detail fields not appearing in the form
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You entered detail field labels but they don't show in the assessment form
  • Form appears incomplete

How to fix

  1. Go to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the relevant assessment type (Diary, Match Day, etc.)
  3. Verify you entered text in the Detail fields (Details 1-6)
  4. Check that you clicked Save assessment design
  5. Create a new assessment and verify the fields appear

Common causes

  • Detail fields were left blank (they're hidden when empty)
  • Changes weren't saved
  • Browser cache

docs.title: Cannot save assessment design
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Error message when you click Save assessment design
  • Page doesn't save changes

How to fix

  1. Verify you have administrator access
  2. Check that you've entered valid information in all fields
  3. Try saving again
  4. If the problem continues, check browser console for errors
  5. Contact your system administrator

Common causes

  • Invalid text in description fields
  • Browser compatibility issue
  • Administrator access expired

docs.title: Admin: View Assessments and Plans
docs.text:
Access Level

Admin Level 1 or higher (Viewer+)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
View all assessments and plans for members in your group. Search for specific entries, view assessment details including reviewer feedback, reassign entries to different members, change reviewers, and delete entries when needed.

This page shows match assessments, diary entries, seasonal reviews, and goal setting plans. You can search by member name, view the full assessment with all ratings and comments, and manage who is assigned to complete reviews.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: Click Admin then View assessments and plans

docs.title: Assessment Types
docs.text:
The system supports different assessment types based on templates set up in your group settings. Each type may show different sections, ratings, and feedback fields.

Type Purpose Diary Observational entry with ratings and comments about a single event or day. Match Day Review Standardised single‑match template for focussed match feedback and ratings. Season Review End‑of‑season summary capturing trends, overall ratings, and recommendations. Media Review Assessment centred on media (video/audio) analysis and timestamped commentary. Custom Review Group‑configured template(s); sections and fields defined by the group — only relevant sections appear when viewing. Peer Review Feedback provided by colleagues/peers, typically reciprocal and discussion‑oriented. Diary (Draft) Diary entry in draft status. Reviewers can provide feedback as a draft review without publishing it. The creator remains able to edit.

When you view an assessment, only the sections relevant to that type appear.

docs.title: Draft
docs.text:
• Entry created but not yet sent to a reviewer
  • Only the person who created it.
  • You can reassign it to another user
  • You can change the reviewer
  • You can delete it

docs.title: Awaiting Review
docs.text:
• Sent to a reviewer
  • The assigned reviewer has not yet completed it
  • You can still change the reviewer
  • You can decline the review (sends it back to Draft/Confidential)
  • You can reassign to a different user

docs.title: Reviewed
docs.text:
• The reviewer has completed the assessment
  • The subject can see it
  • You can click to open and view all reviewer feedback, ratings, and comments
  • You can reassign to a different user
  • You can change the reviewer if needed
  • You cannot decline (already completed)

docs.title: View-Only Assessments
docs.text:
• These are shared for viewing only
  • The reviewer cannot add new ratings or feedback
  • Subject can read the entry but reviewers cannot edit it

docs.title: How to Find Assessments and Plans
View All Assessments
docs.text:
1. Click Admin then View assessments and plans
  2. The page shows all assessment and diary entries for your group
  3. Entries are listed in a table with member name, match details, and status

docs.title: View All Plans
docs.text:
1. Click Admin then View assessments and plans
  2. Click the Plans tab
  3. Plans appear in a table with member name, plan type, assigned reviewer, and status

docs.title: What You See in the Table
docs.text:
Each row shows:

  • Member name: The person who created or was assigned the entry
  • Match or plan details: For assessments, the teams/venue; for plans, the plan type
  • Reviewer: Who is assigned to review it
  • Status: What stage the entry is in (Draft, Awaiting Review, Reviewed, etc.)
  • Date: When the entry was created

Entries are sorted newest first.

docs.title: Search for a Specific Member
docs.text:
1. Enter the member's name in the search box at the top of the page
  2. Click Search
  3. Result: Only entries for that member appear

docs.title: View All Members' Entries
docs.text:
1. Click All Users
  2. Result: All entries for all members in your group appear

docs.title: Assessment State Diagrams
docs.text: For detailed state flow diagrams showing how assessments and plans move through different states, see Assessments and Reviews - States & Flows section in the user documentation.

docs.title: One-Way Feedback Assessment States
docs.text: Some assessment types use one-way feedback where reviewers provide feedback without the subject being able to edit or respond:

docs.title: Match Day Review
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  state "Assigned" as MD_Assigned
  state "Assessment Assigned" as MD_Reviewed
  state "Assessment Deleted" as MD_Archived

  [*] --> MD_Assigned: Admin creates and assigns
  MD_Assigned --> MD_Reviewed: Reviewer completes
  MD_Reviewed --> MD_Archived: Admin deletes

  note right of MD_Reviewed: Subject views only, cannot edit or respond

docs.title: Season Review
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  state "Assigned" as SR_Assigned
  state "Assessment Assigned" as SR_Reviewed
  state "Assessment Deleted" as SR_Archived

  [*] --> SR_Assigned: Admin creates and assigns
  SR_Assigned --> SR_Reviewed: Reviewer completes
  SR_Reviewed --> SR_Archived: Admin deletes

  note right of SR_Reviewed: Subject views only, cannot edit or respond

docs.title: Custom Review
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  state "Assigned" as CR_Assigned
  state "Assessment Assigned" as CR_Reviewed
  state "Assessment Deleted" as CR_Archived

  [*] --> CR_Assigned: Admin creates and assigns
  CR_Assigned --> CR_Reviewed: Reviewer completes
  CR_Reviewed --> CR_Archived: Admin deletes

  note right of CR_Reviewed: Subject views only, cannot edit or respond

docs.title: Plan States
docs.text:
Plans have similar states:

  • Draft: Private, not yet sent for review
  • View Only: Shared for viewing; reviewer cannot make changes
  • Awaiting Review: Sent for feedback
  • Reviewed: Completed and visible to the subject

docs.title: Bulk Actions
docs.text: At the bottom of each table, you can select multiple entries and apply actions to them all at once.

docs.title: For Assessments
docs.text:
1. Check the boxes next to entries you want to action
  2. From the dropdown, select:
  3. Decline: Move back to Draft (only works for Awaiting Review entries)
  4. Delete: Remove the entry (type 1 entries go back to Awaiting Review; others are deleted)
  5. Click Apply Bulk Action
  6. Result: Message shows how many were updated and how many were skipped

docs.title: For Plans
docs.text:
1. Check the boxes next to plans you want to action
  2. From the dropdown, select:
  3. Decline: Move back to Draft (only works for Awaiting Review entries)
  4. Delete: Remove the plan
  5. Click Apply Bulk Action
  6. Result: Message shows how many were updated and how many were skipped

docs.title: Open and View an Assessment
docs.text:
1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click the member name or click View
  3. The assessment opens showing:
  4. Match or assignment details (teams, date, venue, grade)
  5. Original observations and ratings from the person who created it
  6. Reviewer feedback, ratings, and comments (if reviewed)
  7. General reviewer comment
  8. Any media attached (files, videos, documents)
  9. Click Close to go back to the table

docs.title: Open and View a Plan
docs.text:
1. Find the plan in the table
  2. Click the member name or click View
  3. The plan opens showing:
  4. Plan type and date
  5. Member's original comments and entries
  6. Reviewer feedback and responses (if reviewed)
  7. General reviewer response
  8. Click Close to go back

docs.title: Reassign an Assessment to a Different Member
docs.text:
Note

Some assessment types cannot be reassigned. Only Match Day, Season, Media, and Custom reviews can be reassigned. Diary entries, Diary (Draft) entries, Peer reviews, and Plans cannot be reassigned.

Use this when an entry was created by the wrong person or needs to be moved.

  1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click Reassign
  3. A popup appears with a dropdown list of members
  4. Select the new member
  5. Click Reassign entry
  6. Result: The entry now belongs to the selected member; they will see it in their list

Cannot be reassigned: - Diary entries - Diary (Draft) entries

docs.title: Change the Assigned Reviewer
docs.text:
Use this to assign a different person to review an entry that has already been reviewed.

  1. Find the entry in the table (must be in Reviewed status)
  2. Click Change Reviewer
  3. A popup appears with a dropdown list of reviewers
  4. Select the new reviewer
  5. Click Change reviewer
  6. Result: The new reviewer is now assigned; the old reviewer is removed

Who can do this:

  • Requires Reviewer level or higher admin access
  • Only available for entries in Reviewed status (not Draft or Awaiting Review)
  • Only available for certain assessment types (Match Day and others, not Diary entries)
  • If the member belongs to a subgroup, only reviewers with admin in that same subgroup appear in the list
  • The new reviewer must have admin level 1 or higher in the group

docs.title: Decline a Review
docs.text:
Use this to return an entry that is awaiting review back to draft status.

  1. Find the entry (must be in Awaiting Review status)
  2. Click Decline
  3. Result: Entry goes back to Draft; reviewer is removed; it is marked as unviewed

docs.title: Delete an Assessment
docs.text:
Use this to remove an entry completely.

  1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click Delete (from the row menu or bulk actions)
  3. Result:
  4. Type 1 entries (Diary): Return to Awaiting Review status (soft delete)
  5. Other types: Permanently deleted
  6. The entry no longer appears in your list

docs.title: Delete a Plan
docs.text:
Use this to remove a plan completely.

  1. Find the plan in the table
  2. Click Delete (from bulk actions)
  3. Result: Plan is permanently deleted; no longer appears in your list

docs.title: Understanding Media in Assessments
docs.text:
Assessments can include media attachments. When viewing an assessment, media appears in this order:

  • MOS upload: A folder or file you can download from the Match Official System
  • YouTube: An embedded video player (plays directly in the page)
  • Dropbox: A link that opens your Dropbox in a new window
  • OneDrive: A link that opens your OneDrive in a new window

Media is included by the person who created the assessment or the reviewer, depending on the assessment type.

docs.title: Special Workflows: Diary (Draft) Assessment
docs.text: Members can create a diary entry and request review. The review process allows reviewers to work in draft status:

docs.title: What Happens
docs.text:
1. User creates a diary entry and requests review
  2. Reviewer receives the request and opens the diary to review it
  3. Reviewer enters feedback and ratings, then saves as draft review
  4. Draft review is not yet sent to the user
  5. Reviewer can reopen and continue editing their draft review at any time
  6. When ready, reviewer submits the review (changes to final status)
  7. User sees the completed review

docs.title: Who Can Do This
docs.text:
• Reviewers with admin level 1 or higher in the group can review Diary (Draft) entries
  • While a reviewer is working on their review, the diary creator cannot edit the original entry
  • Draft reviews are visible only to the reviewer until submitted
  • Once submitted, the review becomes final and visible to the diary creator

docs.title: Key Points
docs.text:
• A diary can have only one review in progress
  • Draft reviews are temporary and do not count as completed until submitted
  • Reviewers can save their work as a draft without sending it to the member

docs.title: Access Control by Admin Level
docs.text:
Your ability to manage assessments depends on your admin level in the group:

Level What You Can Do Viewer View assessments and plans, search members, view reviews and feedback Reviewer Reassign entries to different members, change reviewer (for reviewed items), review diary entries awaiting review Owner All actions: reassign, change reviewer, decline review, delete, and use bulk actions

Bulk action buttons only appear if you have Owner level access.

docs.title: Tracking Who Has Viewed Assessments
docs.text:
The system tracks whether a member has viewed a reviewed assessment. When they view it and click Mark as read, it's marked as Seen. This helps you know who has viewed their assessment.

For View Only assessments, the system automatically marks them as Seen when an admin opens them to review.

docs.title: Can't Find an Entry
docs.text:
• Check you are on the correct view (Assessments vs Plans)
  • Try searching by member name
  • Click All Users to see every entry in your group
  • Check the user's subgroup - you can only see entries if you have admin access to that subgroup

docs.title: Search Returns No Results
docs.text:
• Check the spelling of the member's name
  • The search looks in member name and reviewer name
  • If searching by name, ensure at least part of the name is spelled correctly
  • Try a broader search (first name only, or last name only)

docs.title: Can't Change Reviewer or Reassign
docs.text:
• Ensure you have Owner level admin access to the group
  • Check that the dropdown list isn't empty - you must have at least one reviewer available
  • For reassign: you can only reassign to users in your group
  • For change reviewer: the new reviewer must have admin level 1 or higher

docs.title: Entry Still Shows Old Reviewer After Change
docs.text:
• Refresh the page (press F5 or Ctrl+R)
  • The change takes effect immediately in the database, but the page cache may show the old value until refreshed

docs.title: Bulk Actions Show "Skipped"
docs.text:
• Entries may be skipped if they are in a state that doesn't allow the action
  • Decline only works on Awaiting Review entries
  • Delete works on all entries (some soft delete, some hard delete)
  • Check the status column to see which entries can be actioned

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use search before applying bulk actions to focus on the right entries
  • Check entry status before trying to decline (only works for Awaiting Review)
  • When reassigning, ensure the new user is in the correct subgroup
  • If changing reviewers frequently, consider using the All Users view to see the full picture
  • Reviewer assignments persist until you change them again

docs.title: Admin: Exam Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner (Administrator)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Build and administer exams using reusable question banks. Assign to users or subgroups with time windows and completion requirements. Analyse results and export for records.

docs.title: Create an Exam
docs.text:
1. Click Create New Exam.
  2. Enter title, description/instructions.
  3. Add questions (from bank or new) and set order.
  4. Save as Draft.

docs.title: Question Types
docs.text:
• Multiple Choice (single answer): One correct option.
  • Multiple Select (multiple answers): Select all that apply.
  • True/False: Binary judgement.
  • Short Answer: Free text; may require manual grading.
  • Essay: Extended response; manual grading.
  • Matching / Drag-and-Drop (if enabled): Pair terms/definitions.
  • Fill in the Blank: Exact or pattern-matched answers.

Enhancements (if available):

  • Shuffle questions/answers per attempt.
  • Pull random questions from categories (e.g., 10 of 30).

docs.title: Creating Questions
docs.text:
Add questions to build your exam:

  1. Open the exam and click Add Question.
  2. Choose a question type (Multiple Choice, True/False, Short Answer, Essay, Matching, Fill in the Blank).
  3. Enter the question text and answers (mark the correct option(s) where applicable).
  4. Set points and optional explanation shown after submission.
  5. Click Save Question.

Tips:

  • Use clear wording and avoid ambiguity.
  • Mix difficulty levels and question types.

  • Provide explanations to aid learning.

  • Points per question and overall weighting.

  • Pass mark as percentage or raw score.
  • Attempts allowed (1, limited, or unlimited within window).
  • Time window: Start/end dates; Time limit per attempt (optional).
  • Must-complete flag: Blocks other workflows until completed (use sparingly).
  • Accommodations: Extended time for specific users (if supported).

docs.title: Publish and Assign
docs.text:
1. Set exam to Published when ready.
  2. Assign to individual users, subgroups, or entire group.
  3. Configure availability window and reminders.
  4. Notify assignees by email (if enabled).

docs.title: Monitor and Results
docs.text:
• Attempts: Started vs. completed counts.
  • Scores: Individual and average scores; pass/fail.
  • Question analysis: Difficulty index, most missed items (where available).
  • Manual grading: Review and score Short Answer/Essay.
  • Export: Download results to CSV for archiving/audits.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Users can’t see exam: Check publish state, assignment scope, and date window.
  • Results missing: Ensure attempts were submitted; check filters.
  • Essay questions ungraded: Complete manual grading to finalise scores.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Pilot exams with a small group first.
  • ✅ Mix question types to test understanding, not memorisation.
  • ✅ Keep instructions clear and include expected duration.
  • ✅ Use randomisation to reduce sharing of answers.

docs.title: Getting Started: New Organisations
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner required

Welcome to the Match Official System. This guide walks you through the essential setup steps to get your organisation operational.

docs.title: What You Need to Do First
docs.text: When you first log in as an administrator, you need to configure your group's settings and assessment templates. This typically takes 30-45 minutes and only needs to be done once or as you change your templates to enrich data over site.

docs.title: Step 1: Access Group Settings
docs.text:
1. From the main menu, click Admin
  2. Click Group Settings
  3. You see the Group Settings page with several tabs on the left sidebar

The first section shows your License Information - this tells you how many users and subgroups your organisation is entitled to.

docs.title: Step 2: Set Up Your Organisation Details
Configure Calendar Start
docs.text:
1. Click the Calendar Start tab
  2. Select the month when your calendar year begins (e.g., July for a football season starting in July)
  3. This month becomes the first month throughout the system

docs.title: Configure Location
docs.text:
1. Click the Location tab
  2. Enter your group's primary location or city
  3. Enter your postcode
  4. Click Save location

Your location is used for weather information and location-based features.

docs.title: Step 3: Configure User Access
docs.text: These settings determine which folders and features are available to users.

docs.title: Enable Folder Access
docs.text:
1. Click the Folder Settings tab
  2. Select Yes for:
  3. User folder - Allows each user to have a personal file storage area
  4. Subgroups folder - Allows subgroups to have shared file storage areas
  5. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Configure User Response Options
docs.text:
1. Click the User responses tab
  2. Decide which features users can access:
  3. Confidential entries (private entries not visible to others)
  4. View only entries (shareable but not editable by others)
  5. Review requests (ability to request feedback)
  6. Check both Diary and Plan sections
  7. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Set Up Notifications
docs.text:
1. Click the Notifications tab
  2. For each notification type (Diary, Assessment, Plan, Peer), select Yes or No to enable email alerts
  3. Start with Yes for most notifications to keep users informed
  4. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Step 4: Create Subgroups (Optional)
docs.text:
If your organisation has teams, departments, or divisions, create subgroups.

  1. Click the Subgroups tab
  2. For each subgroup, enter the name and click Add subgroup
  3. Common subgroups:
  4. Team 1, Team 2, Team 3 (for sports organisations)
  5. Department A, Department B (for administrative divisions)
  6. Region North, Region South (for geographic divisions)

Each subgroup gets its own folder and can have its own members.

docs.title: Step 5: Add Quick Links (Optional)
docs.text:
Quick links appear on the home page and help users access important resources.

  1. Click the Quick Links tab
  2. Add links for:
  3. Your organisation's website
  4. Training resources
  5. Policies and procedures
  6. Contact information
  7. Select an icon for each link
  8. Click Add quick link

docs.title: Step 6: Set Up User Registration (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want new users to register themselves instead of creating accounts manually:

  1. Click the User registration tab
  2. Select Yes
  3. Share the provided registration URL with potential users
  4. New users who register will need to be assigned to subgroups by an administrator

docs.title: Step 7: Configure Assessment Templates
docs.text:
Now that the basic group settings are complete, configure how assessments will work.

Important: Plan Your Templates Carefully

Before you start, plan your templates carefully. Each time you modify a template, the previous version is archived to preserve historical data. Frequent changes can create data inconsistency. Design once, then only modify if absolutely necessary.

  1. From the Admin menu, click Group Settings again
  2. Click the Assessment templates tab
  3. You see two main sections: Assessments and Plans

docs.title: Diary Template
docs.text:
Your users will likely create diary entries most frequently. Configure this first:

  1. Click Diary in the Assessments section
  2. Set Number of days to 3 (most commonly used)
  3. Enable Allow users to request review? - Set to Yes
  4. Enable User can see ratings section? - Set to Yes
  5. Enable User can see comments section? - Set to Yes
  6. For admin visibility, select:
  7. Admin ratings: Yes, response shared with user
  8. Admin comments: Yes, response shared with user
  9. Enter a User Description explaining how to complete diary entries
  10. Enter an Admin Description with guidance for reviewing
  11. For the 6 detail fields, enter custom fields relevant to your organisation:
  12. Detail 1: "Key decisions"
  13. Detail 2: "Performance observations"
  14. Detail 3: "Areas for improvement"
  15. Leave Details 4-6 blank if you don't need them
  16. Remember: Diary entries always include three hardcoded fields: Team A, Team B, and Venue
  17. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Match Day Template
docs.text:
Configure assessments for specific match/event days:

  1. Click Match Day
  2. Set Number of days to 1
  3. Select Show ratings section? - Choose appropriate visibility
  4. Select Show comments section? - Choose appropriate visibility
  5. Add 6 custom detail fields:
  6. Detail 1: "In-game decisions"
  7. Detail 2: "Communication"
  8. Detail 3: "Positioning"
  9. Detail 4: "Positioning"
  10. Detail 5: "Player management"
  11. Detail 6: "Overall performance"
  12. Remember: Match day entries always include: Team A, Team B, and Venue
  13. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Other Assessment Types
docs.text:
Configure the remaining types based on your needs:

  • Season: For longer-term reviews (usually just detail fields, no ratings/comments)
  • Media: For video/image assessments
  • Custom: For organisation-specific assessments
  • Peer: For peer-to-peer reviews between officials

For each: 1. Click the type name 2. Add detail fields relevant to your organisation 3. Configure ratings and comments visibility 4. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Step 8: Set Up Rating Scales
docs.text:
1. Still in Assessment Templates, click the Ratings tab
  2. Add rating options users will see. For example:
  3. "Excellent - Far exceeds expectations"
  4. "Good - Meets expectations"
  5. "Needs improvement - Below expectations"
  6. "Not assessed"
  7. For each, click Add rating

These ratings appear in all assessment forms.

docs.title: Step 9: Create Competitions (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want to track specific competitions or events:

  1. Click the Competitions tab
  2. Enter competition or event names
  3. Click Add competition

Examples: - "Premier League" - "Cup Competition" - "Tournament" - "Friendly"

docs.title: Step 10: Customise Ratings and Comments (Advanced)
docs.text:
For more advanced configuration, you can customise rating and comment fields per assessment type:

  1. Go to each assessment type (Diary, Match Day, etc.)
  2. Scroll to see rating options (Rating 1 through Rating 20)
  3. Enter custom rating labels specific to your organisation
  4. Below that, enter comment field labels (Comment 1 through Comment 10)
  5. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: For a Football Association
docs.text:
Group Settings - Calendar Start: January - Location: headquarters city - User folder: Yes - Subgroups folder: Yes - Create subgroups: Referees, Assistants, Video Assistants - Notifications: enable Match/Assessment and Review alerts as needed

Assessment Templates - Diary: Number of days = 1; full ratings and comments enabled; allow review requests - Match Day: Number of days = 1; - Peer: Number of days = 1; peer ratings enabled (confidential option available) - Media: enable for video/image attachments where required

Detail fields (examples) - Decision making - Positioning - Communication - Game awareness

Ratings - Excellent — Exceeds expectations - Good — Meets expectations - Satisfactory — Meets basic expectations - Needs improvement — Below expectations

Suggested defaults 1. Diary: 1 day; allow review requests; user and admin ratings + comments visible 2. Match Day: 1 day; include hardcoded fields; media uploads optional 3. Peer: peer ratings enabled; confidentiality option on request

docs.title: For a Cricket Association
docs.text:
Group Settings - Calendar Start: April - Location: county or club headquarters - User folder: Yes - Subgroups folder: Yes - Create subgroups: Umpires, Scorers, Coaches, Squad panels - Notifications: enable Match/Assessment and Review alerts

Assessment Templates - Diary: Number of days = 2; ratings and comments enabled - Match Day: Number of days = 1; - Peer: Number of days = 2; peer feedback enabled - Media: for video/image reviews and timestamped comments - Season: end‑of‑season summary reviews - Custom: fitness and technical skills assessments

Detail fields (examples) - Decision making - Positioning & movement - Communication - Playing conditions - Match management - Teamwork - Use of technology (e.g., DRS/video)

Ratings - Excellent — Far exceeds expectations - Good — Meets expectations - Satisfactory — Acceptable standard - Needs improvement — Below expectations - Not assessed

Suggested defaults 1. Diary: 1 day; allow review requests; user/admin ratings and comments visible 2. Match Day: 1 day; include the three hardcoded fields; enable media uploads and time‑coded comments 3. Peer: peer ratings enabled with confidential option 4. Media: allow reviewers to timestamp clips and leave time‑coded comments

docs.title: For a Sports Development Programme
docs.text:
Group Settings - Calendar Start: September - Location: facility location - User folder: Yes - Subgroups folder: Yes - Create subgroups: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced - Notifications: enable training and progress alerts

Assessment Templates - Diary: Number of days = 2; comments only for reflective learning - Custom: development progress tracking - Season: end‑of‑season reviews

Detail fields (examples) - Technical skills - Fitness level - Tactical understanding - Teamwork - Development goals

Suggested defaults 1. Diary: 2 days; comments only for reflection and coaching notes 2. Custom: track progression against learning outcomes 3. Season: summary focus with fewer ratings

docs.title: For a High Performance Programme
docs.text:
Group Settings - Calendar Start: January - Location: performance centre or headquarters - User folder: Yes - Subgroups folder: Yes - Create subgroups: Department A, Department B (or by sport/discipline) - Notifications: all enabled (daily/weekly summaries)

Assessment Templates - Diary: Number of days = 1; comments only for rapid feedback - Season: quarterly reviews (summary and trends) - Custom: training module and competency assessments - Media: support for technical video review

Detail fields (examples) - Learning outcomes - Competency demonstrated - Areas for development - Next steps - Fitness and recovery metrics

Suggested defaults 1. Diary: 1 day; comments only to capture immediate coaching notes 2. Season: quarterly cadence with trend reporting 3. Custom: align templates to training modules and competency frameworks

These examples are practical starting points — tailor fields, visibility and notification settings to match your organisation's workflows and governance.

docs.title: What to Do After Setup
docs.text:
Once you've completed these setup steps:

  1. Add users to your group (see User Management)
  2. Assign users to subgroups if you created them
  3. Share the registration link with potential users (if registration is enabled)
  4. Test a sample entry by creating a diary or assessment yourself
  5. Communicate settings to users so they know what to expect

docs.title: How long does setup take?
docs.text: Most organisations complete setup in 30-45 minutes on the first attempt. You can always adjust settings later.

docs.title: Can I change settings after setup?
docs.text: Yes. All settings can be modified at any time. Changes to templates only apply to new assessments created after the change.

docs.title: Do existing entries change if I modify a template?
docs.text: No. Existing assessments keep their original format. Only new assessments use the updated template.

docs.title: What should I do if I'm not sure about a setting?
docs.text: Start with the recommended defaults and adjust later based on user feedback. Settings can be changed anytime without affecting existing data.

docs.title: Who can see the entries users create?
docs.text: That depends on your response settings. By default: - Users can make entries confidential (private) - Admins can see all entries - Reviewers can only see entries assigned to them - Users can request reviews

docs.text:
If you need assistance:

  1. Check the detailed guides linked above
  2. Review the troubleshooting sections in each guide
  3. Contact Cortana Design support for technical issues

docs.title: Group Settings
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner (Administrator)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Group Settings allows administrators to manage how your organisation operates within the Match Official System. You can control user registration, calendar dates, folder access, notification settings, and how users interact with assessments and plans.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: From the main menu, click Admin then Group Settings.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• You must be an administrator with the correct access level
  • Changes to group settings affect all users in your group
  • Some settings are destructive (such as folder deletion) and cannot be easily undone
  • Your group's licence information is displayed at the top of the page

docs.title: Subgroups
docs.text:
Subgroups allow you to organise teams or departments within your group. Each subgroup can have its own members and folder structure.

View and manage existing subgroups:

  1. Navigate to Group Settings
  2. Click the Subgroups tab
  3. You see a list of all subgroups in your group
  4. For each subgroup, you can:
  5. Click Edit to rename it
  6. Click Delete to remove it (the subgroup folder will be deleted)
  7. Click Recreate Folder to restore a missing folder (if folder viewing is enabled)

Add a new subgroup:

  1. In the Subgroups section, enter the subgroup name in the text field
  2. Click Add subgroup
  3. A new subgroup is created with its own folder
  4. You can now add users to this subgroup

Note

The number of subgroups you can create depends on your licence.

docs.title: Theme
docs.text:
Choose the visual appearance of the system for your group.

Change the group theme:

  1. In the Major Settings section, click the Theme tab
  2. Click on a theme image to select it
  3. The system reloads and applies your new theme immediately
  4. All users in your group see the new theme

If you need a custom theme, contact Cortana Design.

docs.title: User Registration
docs.text:
Control whether new users can register themselves with your group.

Enable or disable user registration:

  1. Click the User registration tab
  2. Select Yes to allow registration or No to disable it
  3. If enabled, you see a registration URL that you can share with potential users
  4. New users who register will have group-level access (administrators must assign them to subgroups afterwards)

docs.title: Calendar Start
docs.text:
Set which month marks the beginning of your calendar year.

Change the calendar start month:

  1. Click the Calendar Start tab
  2. Select your preferred starting month from the dropdown
  3. The selected month is now the first month of your calendar year throughout the system

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
Store your group's default location and postcode for weather information and location-based features.

Save location details:

  1. Click the Location tab
  2. Enter your group's location (town/city)
  3. Enter your postcode
  4. Click Save location
  5. Result: These details are stored and used for location-based features

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
Manage shortcut links that appear on the home page for your group.

View quick links:

  1. Click the Quick Links tab
  2. You see a table of all links currently displayed

Add a new quick link:

  1. In the Quick Links section, enter:
  2. Link title: The text users see
  3. Link url: The full web address (e.g., https://example.com)
  4. Icon: Select an icon from the dropdown (optional)
  5. Click Add quick link
  6. The link is added to the home page immediately

Edit a quick link:

  1. Click Edit next to the link
  2. Update the title, URL, or icon
  3. Click Update

Delete a quick link:

  1. Click Delete next to the link
  2. The link is removed from the home page

docs.title: User Access and Actions
docs.text: These settings control what features users can access and what actions they can perform.

docs.title: Folder Settings
docs.text:
Control whether users can access the User folder and Subgroups folder.

Enable or disable folders:

  1. Click the Folder Settings tab
  2. For User folder: Select Yes to enable or No to disable
  3. For Subgroups folder: Select Yes to enable or No to disable
  4. Click Save user settings at the bottom of the page

Warning

Disabling a folder will delete it and all its contents. This cannot be undone.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
Control whether users can access specific assessment types.

Enable or disable peer assessments:

  1. Click the Modules tab
  2. Select Yes to allow peer assessments or No to disable them
  3. Click Save user settings

Enable or disable user search:

  1. In the Modules section, select Yes to allow users to search profile information or No to disable it
  2. Click Save user settings

docs.title: User Responses
docs.text:
Control what options users have when creating assessments and plans.

Diary entries - Allow users to:

  1. Click the User responses tab
  2. Make entries confidential: Select Yes or No
  3. Make entries view only: Select Yes or No
  4. Request a review: Select Yes or No

Plan entries - Allow users to:

  1. Make entries confidential: Select Yes or No
  2. Make entries view only: Select Yes or No
  3. Request a review: Select Yes or No

All settings can be customised per response type.

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Configure automatic email notifications for various activities.

Diary notification settings:

  1. Click the Notifications tab
  2. Under "Notifications for diary entries", choose Yes or No for:
  3. Notify reviewers of new review requests
  4. Notify user when reviewed
  5. Notify reviewer when entry is seen by user
  6. Click Save user settings

Assessment notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for assessment entries", choose Yes or No for:
  2. Notify user when new assessment is assigned
  3. Notify reviewer when assessment is seen by user
  4. Click Save user settings

Plan notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for plan entries", choose Yes or No for:
  2. Notify reviewers of new review requests
  3. Notify user when reviewed
  4. Notify reviewer when seen by user
  5. Notify user when reviewer has seen view-only entries
  6. Click Save user settings

Peer review notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for peer review entries", choose Yes or No for:
  2. Notify user of review
  3. Notify admin(s) of review
  4. Notify reviewee when review seen
  5. Notify admin(s) when review seen
  6. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Create a new subgroup
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Group Settings
  2. In the Subgroups section, enter a name for your new subgroup
  3. Click Add subgroup
  4. The subgroup is created with its own folder
  5. Add users to the subgroup through the Membership section

docs.title: Change your group's theme
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Theme tab
  3. Click on the theme image you want to use
  4. The page reloads with the new theme applied

docs.title: Enable user registration for your group
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the User registration tab
  3. Select Yes
  4. Share the registration URL with potential users
  5. New users can register themselves

docs.title: Set when your calendar year starts
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Calendar Start tab
  3. Select the month your calendar year begins
  4. All dates throughout the system reflect this starting month

docs.title: Add multiple quick links
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Quick Links tab
  3. Add the first link: enter title, URL, and icon, then click Add quick link
  4. Add the second link: repeat the process
  5. Continue for each link
  6. All links appear on the home page in order

docs.title: Restrict folder access
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Folder Settings tab
  3. Select No for User folder or Subgroups folder (or both)
  4. Click Save user settings
  5. Users no longer see or access that folder

Warning

Folders will be deleted along with all their contents.

docs.title: Settings not saving
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You click Save but the settings don't change
  • Error message appears

How to fix

  1. Check that you have administrator access
  2. Verify all required fields are completed
  3. Try saving again
  4. If the problem continues, contact your system administrator

Common causes

  • Insufficient access permissions
  • Missing or invalid information in fields
  • Browser cache issues

docs.title: Quick links not appearing on home page
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You added a quick link but don't see it
  • Links appear for some users but not others

How to fix

  1. Go back to Group Settings
  2. Click the Quick Links tab
  3. Verify the link was created (it should appear in the table)
  4. Check that the URL is valid and starts with http:// or https://
  5. Clear your browser cache and refresh the page

Common causes

  • URL format is incorrect
  • Browser cache preventing display of new link
  • User permissions preventing access

docs.title: Folder is missing
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • A subgroup folder is marked as missing
  • Users cannot access the folder

How to fix

  1. Go to Group Settings
  2. In the Subgroups section, click Recreate Folder next to the missing subgroup
  3. The folder is recreated
  4. Users can now access it again

Note: Folder recreation is only available if folder viewing is enabled in Folder Settings.

docs.text:

  • User Management - Add and manage users
  • Membership - Assign users to groups and subgroups

docs.title: Admin: Group Membership
docs.text:
Warning

Owner access required - Owner role only

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Manage who belongs to your group and what they can do. Organise users into subgroups, assign permission levels, and keep membership aligned with your association structure.

docs.title: Permission Levels
docs.text:
• User: Standard member access.
  • Viewer: Read-only access across areas (cannot modify).
  • Reviewer: Can assess/review where applicable.
  • Owner: Full administrative control.

Choose the least privilege level required for the member's role.

docs.title: Find Members
docs.text:
• Search: Type a name or email, then Search.
  • Filter: Show by access level (User, Viewer, Reviewer, Owner).
  • Clear: Reset filters to see all.

docs.title: Add Members
docs.text:
Add existing system users into your group, or invite new ones if enabled.

  1. Click Add Member or Invite Member.
  2. Search by name or email, select the person.
  3. Choose Permission Level.
  4. Assign to Subgroup(s) (optional, recommended).
  5. Confirm.

Invitations (if enabled):

  • Sends an email with a registration link to join your group.
  • Links may expire; re-send as needed.

docs.title: Edit Permissions
docs.text:
1. Click Edit next to a member.
  2. Change Permission Level.
  3. Update Subgroup assignments.
  4. Save changes.

Considerations:

  • Permission changes take effect immediately.
  • Reviewers may gain access to assessment tools and reports.

docs.title: Remove Members
docs.text:
• Click Remove on a user to revoke group access.
  • Removing does not delete the person from MOS - only from your group.
  • Re-add later if needed.

docs.title: Subgroups
docs.text:
Use subgroups to mirror teams, regions, or squads.

  • Expand/Collapse to manage subgroup members.
  • Users can belong to multiple subgroups.
  • Subgroup membership often controls visibility of news, reports, and files.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• User not found: The person may not exist in MOS yet - send an invite.
  • Cannot change level: Restricted by policy - contact an Owner or support.
  • Visibility issues: Ensure subgroup assignments are correct.
  • Duplicate members: Remove the redundant entry and keep a single membership record.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Apply the principle of least privilege.
  • ✅ Keep subgroup membership up to date.
  • ✅ Review Reviewer/Owner lists quarterly.
  • ✅ Document changes for compliance where required.

docs.title: News Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner (Administrator)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Create and manage news articles for your association. You can publish articles to all members or target specific subgroups, optionally send email notifications, and attach files. If enabled, you can also create articles by sending emails to a designated mailbox.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
1. Click Admin
  2. Select News Management
  3. Result: The News Management page opens showing all existing articles

docs.title: How to Create an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Click New News
  3. Enter a Title for the article
  4. Select your Audience:
  5. Select All Users to reach all members in your association
  6. Select a subgroup name to reach only members of that group
  7. Choose if you want to send a notification email:
  8. Select Yes to email all members in the audience
  9. Select No to skip email notification
  10. Insert an image (optional):
  11. Click the upload area under Insert Image
  12. Select and upload an image file
  13. Enter your article content in the Content field
  14. Add attachments (optional):
  15. Click the upload area under Add Attachments
  16. Select one or more files to attach
  17. Click Save
  18. Result: The article is created and immediately visible to the audience you selected. If you selected Yes for notifications, members will receive an email with the article title and content.

Fields:

  • Title (required): The article headline
  • Audience (required): Who receives this article. Choose All Users for everyone or select a specific subgroup
  • Send notification (required): Whether to email the article to your audience
  • Insert Image (optional): Add a visual to the article
  • Content (required): The full article text
  • Add Attachments (optional): Include documents, PDFs, or other files

Tips:

  • Keep titles clear and descriptive
  • Target specific subgroups when the news only affects certain members
  • Use attachments to share supporting documents
  • Send email notifications for important announcements

docs.title: How to Edit an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Find the article you want to edit
  3. Click Edit
  4. Update the title, audience, content, or attachments
  5. Click Save
  6. Result: The article is updated immediately

Note

When editing, if you upload new attachments, they replace any existing attachments

docs.title: How to Delete an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Find the article you want to delete
  3. Click Delete
  4. Confirm the deletion when prompted
  5. Result: The article is permanently removed from the news feed

docs.title: Email-to-News (Optional Feature)
docs.text: Your group may have Email-to-News enabled, which allows you to create news articles by sending an email to a designated mailbox.

docs.title: How to Use Email-to-News
docs.text:
1. On the News Management page, find the Email-to-News section (if enabled for your group)
  2. Note the mailbox address provided (e.g., mos-news@matchofficialsystem.com)
  3. Send an email to that address with:
  4. Subject: The article title
  5. Body: The article content
  6. Attachments: Any files to include with the article
  7. Result: The article is automatically created and sent to all members in your group

Tips:

  • Keep subjects concise and descriptive
  • Format your email body clearly (line breaks will be preserved)
  • Attachments should be reasonable file sizes
  • Articles created via email follow the same targeting as manual articles (applies to entire group)

Note

The senders email address must match a owner of the association. If the emails don't match, the email will be rejected.

docs.title: No articles appear on the News page
docs.text:
Symptoms: The News page shows no articles

How to Fix:

  1. Check that you are logged in to your account
  2. Verify you have membership in at least one group or association
  3. Check with your administrator to confirm articles have been published
  4. Try refreshing the page

Common Causes:

  • No articles have been published for your association or subgroups
  • Your membership may not include access to published news

docs.title: Articles I created don't appear
docs.text:
Symptoms: News article created but not visible to members

How to Fix:

  1. Verify the audience is set correctly:
  2. Check if you selected All Users or a subgroup
  3. Only members of the selected audience can see the article
  4. Check that the article was saved successfully (look for confirmation message)
  5. Try refreshing the news page
  6. Verify members are actually part of the audience group

Common Causes:

  • Article is targeted to wrong audience
  • Members are not subscribed to the audience subgroup
  • Article was not saved successfully

docs.title: Attachments don't download
docs.text:
Symptoms: Clicking an attachment doesn't open or download the file

How to Fix:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Check your internet connection
  3. Verify you are logged in
  4. Try a different file if multiple attachments exist
  5. Contact your administrator if the problem continues

Common Causes:

  • The file may have been removed
  • Temporary network issue
  • File may be too large

docs.title: Email notification not received
docs.text:
Symptoms: Members didn't receive email after publishing article

How to Fix:

  1. Check that Send notification was set to Yes when creating the article
  2. Verify members have email addresses in their profiles
  3. Check their email spam or junk folder
  4. Ask members to check their email preferences (unsubscribe setting)

Common Causes:

  • Notification was set to No instead of Yes
  • Members have opted out of email notifications
  • Email was filtered as spam

  • User Management: Manage member access and groups

docs.text:
This content is now consolidated under a single admin page:

  • See Admin: Assessments for viewing and managing assessments and plans.

Why the change:

docs.title: Admin: User Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner (Administrator)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Manage users in your organisation through this page. You can view all users, search for specific members, edit user details, add new users individually or in bulk, and export your user list for reporting purposes.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: Click Admin then User Management

docs.title: Viewing Your Users
docs.text:
When you open the page, you see a table listing all users in your group. The table shows:

  • Profile - User photo or avatar
  • Name - First and last name
  • Email - Primary email address (used for login)
  • Phone - Contact number if provided
  • Address - Suburb or location if provided
  • Last Login - Date and time of most recent sign-in
  • Actions - Edit, delete, and other options

docs.title: Searching for Users
docs.text:
To find a specific user:

  1. Enter their name or email in the search box at the top
  2. Click Search
  3. Result: Only matching users appear in the table

To see all users again:

  1. Click All Users
  2. Result: The full user list displays

docs.title: Editing User Details
docs.text:
To update a user's information:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name
  2. Update any of these fields:
  3. First name and surname
  4. Email address
  5. Secondary email
  6. Phone numbers (home, work, mobile)
  7. Address details (house number, street, suburb, postcode, state, country)
  8. Shirt and pants size
  9. Occupation
  10. About me biography
  11. Click Save
  12. Result: Changes are saved and the list updates

Note

Email address changes are reflected in the system immediately. If you change someone's email, they should know their username may have changed for login purposes (depending on your group settings).

docs.title: Add User Individually
docs.text:
To add one user at a time:

  1. Click Add User at the top of the page
  2. Enter the user's:
  3. First name (required)
  4. Surname (required)
  5. Email address (required)
  6. Click Continue
  7. Depending on whether the email is new to the system:
  8. New email: A new account is created with an automatically generated username (firstname.surname format)
  9. Existing email: The system links the existing user to your group and displays their current details
  10. Update any additional details (address, phone, etc.) if needed
  11. Click Save
  12. Result: The user receives a welcome email with login instructions

docs.title: Bulk Import Users
docs.text:
To add multiple users from a CSV file:

  1. Click Bulk Import at the top
  2. Select a CSV file with three columns: firstName, surname, emailAddress
  3. Example CSV format:
firstName,surname,emailAddress
John,Smith,john.smith@example.com
Jane,Doe,jane.doe@example.com
  1. Click Upload
  2. Result: The system processes the file and shows:
  3. How many accounts were created successfully
  4. How many had errors (usually duplicate emails)
  5. Which accounts could not be created and why

Warning

  • Each imported user counts as a new license seat
  • Make sure you have enough available licenses before importing
  • Emails must be valid and unique (not already in use by another account in the system)
  • Names are automatically capitalized (John, Jane, etc.)
  • Usernames are generated automatically from first and last names

docs.title: Deleting a User
docs.text:
To remove a user from your group:

  1. Click Delete next to the user's name
  2. Confirm the deletion
  3. Result: The user is removed from your group

Warning

This action is permanent. Consider whether you want to remove group access only (see Group Membership) rather than deleting the user entirely. Deleted users' assessments remain in the system but are no longer associated with an active user.

docs.title: Exporting Users
docs.text:
To download a list of all your users:

  1. Click Export All Users
  2. Result: A CSV file downloads with user information
  3. Use this for:
  4. Compliance and audit records
  5. Importing into other systems
  6. Reporting and analysis
  7. Backup documentation

docs.title: Viewing Group and Subgroup Membership
docs.text: When you edit a user, you can see which groups and subgroups they belong to. This information appears in separate sections on the edit form.

docs.title: Cannot edit user details
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Edit button is disabled or missing
  • Cannot save changes to user information

How to fix

  1. Verify you have Owner-level access
  2. Make sure the user account exists and hasn't been deleted
  3. Try clicking Edit again
  4. Check that all required fields have values
  5. Clear any browser cache if changes seem not to save

Common causes

  • Insufficient admin access level
  • User account is in an invalid state
  • Browser cache or connection issue

docs.title: Cannot add new user - email already exists
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Error message when trying to add a user
  • "Email is already in use" or similar message

How to fix

  1. Check if the email belongs to an existing user in your group
  2. Check if the email was used by a deleted account
  3. If the user should be in your group:
  4. Search for them in the current user list
  5. Consider adding them through Group Membership instead
  6. If it's a new user, use a different email address

Common causes

  • Email is already linked to an active account in your group
  • Email was previously used and account is still in system
  • Typo in email address - check spelling

docs.title: Bulk import failed - not enough licenses
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Bulk import upload fails with a license message
  • Import process stops before completing

How to fix

  1. Check your current license allocation in Group Settings
  2. Reduce the number of users in your CSV file
  3. Import them in smaller batches
  4. Contact Cortana Design to increase your license limit

Common causes

  • Not enough spare user seats available
  • Existing users are using all allocated licenses

docs.title: Export file is empty or incomplete
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Downloaded CSV file has no data or is missing users
  • Export shows fewer users than expected

How to fix

  1. Click Export All Users again
  2. Check the file opened correctly in your spreadsheet application
  3. Verify you're viewing the correct sheet if it's a multi-sheet file
  4. Try opening in a different application (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)

Common causes

  • File didn't download completely
  • Application wasn't configured to open CSV files
  • Large export may take a moment to process

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Keep user details current - accurate phone numbers and addresses ensure notifications reach the right people
  • ✅ Use bulk import for initial setup with many users
  • ✅ Export your user list regularly for backup and compliance
  • ✅ Use Search before editing if you have a large user base
  • ✅ Check group membership when adding users - they may already exist in another group you manage

docs.title: Exams: Complete Assessments
docs.text:
Access Level

User, Viewer, Reviewer, Owner

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Complete exams that have been assigned to you. Answer questions, submit your responses, and view your results. Exams may be graded automatically or by your administrator.

How to Access: Click Assessments then Exams

docs.title: Finding Your Exams
docs.text:
1. Open Assessments → Exams
  2. You see a list of exams assigned to you
  3. Exams show the title, due date, status, and actions available

Exam Status:

  • Not Started: You haven't opened this exam yet
  • In Progress: You started but didn't finish
  • Submitted: You completed and submitted the exam
  • Results Available: Your score and feedback are ready to view

docs.title: How to Start and Complete an Exam
docs.text:
1. Find your exam in the list
  2. Click Start or Resume (if continuing from in progress)
  3. Read the instructions and first question carefully
  4. Select your answer:
  5. Multiple Choice: Click the correct option
  6. True/False: Select True or False
  7. Short Answer: Type your response
  8. Multiple Select: Check all correct answers
  9. Matching: Pair items correctly
  10. Fill in the Blank: Type the missing word or phrase
  11. Click Next to move to the next question
  12. Repeat steps 4-5 for all questions
  13. When finished, click Submit
  14. Result: Your exam is submitted and you see your score (if auto-graded)

Tips:

  • Take your time; questions may require careful reading
  • Ensure a stable internet connection before starting
  • Avoid refreshing or navigating away mid-exam if possible
  • Review your answers before submitting if the exam allows it

docs.title: Exam Results
docs.text:
After submitting your exam:

  • Your Score displays immediately if auto-graded
  • Some exams include explanations for correct answers
  • Your administrator may publish additional feedback or pass marks

docs.title: How to Review Past Results
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments → Exams
  2. Look for Previous Results or Completed section
  3. Click an exam to see your score and details
  4. Review any feedback or explanations provided

docs.title: Retake an Exam (if allowed)
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments → Exams
  2. Find the exam you want to retake
  3. If a Retake button appears, click it
  4. Complete the exam again following the steps above
  5. Submit your new responses

Note

Not all exams allow retakes. Check with your administrator if you're unsure.

docs.title: Check Pass Mark and Attempts
docs.text:
1. Open the exam details or look at the exam list
  2. Review Pass Mark and Maximum Attempts (if shown)
  3. If uncertain, contact your administrator

docs.title: Understand Your Score
docs.text:
• Percentage Score: Your percentage of correct answers
  • Raw Score: Total points earned vs. total available
  • Pass/Fail: Whether you achieved the required pass mark
  • Feedback: Comments from your administrator (if provided)

docs.title: Exam will not start
docs.text:
Symptoms: The Start button is grayed out or doesn't work

How to Fix:

  1. Verify you have an assigned exam
  2. Check the exam availability window (it may not be open yet)
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. Log out and back in, then try again
  5. Try a different browser
  6. Contact your administrator if the issue persists

Common Causes:

  • Exam window not yet open
  • Exam window has closed
  • You don't have access to this exam
  • Browser/connection issue

docs.title: Answers not saving
docs.text:
Symptoms: Your responses disappear when you move to the next question

How to Fix:

  1. Wait for pages to load fully before clicking Next
  2. Avoid using the browser Back button
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. If the problem repeats, report it to your administrator immediately

Common Causes:

  • Network connectivity issue
  • Page didn't load completely
  • Using browser navigation while exam is loading

docs.title: Unexpected logout during exam
docs.text:
Symptoms: You're logged out and sent to the login page during the exam

How to Fix:

  1. Log back in with your credentials
  2. Return to Assessments → Exams
  3. Your progress may have been saved; click Resume to continue
  4. If progress didn't save, contact your administrator

Common Causes:

  • Session timeout due to inactivity
  • Network issue causing logout
  • System maintenance

docs.title: Stuck on a question
docs.text:
Symptoms: You can't move past a particular question

How to Fix:

  1. Ensure you have selected an answer (all required fields are filled)
  2. If multiple choice, verify you selected exactly one option (unless it's multiple select)
  3. Refresh the page carefully
  4. Contact your administrator if the issue persists

docs.title: Can't submit the exam
docs.text:
Symptoms: Submit button is grayed out or doesn't work

How to Fix:

  1. Verify all questions have been answered (check for red asterisks or error messages)
  2. Scroll through the entire exam to check all questions
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. Try again in a few moments
  5. Contact your administrator if submission fails repeatedly

docs.text:
