  • Reports: View your exam trends and pass rates

docs.title: Assessments and Reviews: Manage Your Development
docs.text:
Access Level

All users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Create and manage your Diary and Plan entries, and view reviews and assessments assigned to you. Use bulk actions to keep things tidy and export your data when needed.

How to Access: Click Assessments

docs.title: My Assessments
docs.text:
A list of your match-related assessments and reviews.

  • Shows subject, date, association, status, and whether you have viewed it.
  • Use the pager to browse older items.

docs.title: Bulk actions
docs.text:
• Mark as read: Acknowledges reviewed items that you haven’t viewed yet.
  • Revert to confidential: Moves an item back to your private view (when allowed).
  • Delete: Removes your own entries that are not assigned assessments.

Result: A success banner confirms how many items were updated or skipped.

docs.title: My Plans
docs.text:
Personal planning entries (goals, actions, timeframes) with reviewer feedback when applicable.

  • Shows date, description, review state, and whether you have viewed it.

docs.title: Bulk actions
docs.text:
• Mark as read: Acknowledges reviewed plans you haven’t viewed yet.
  • Archive: Moves plans to your archive to keep your main list focused.
  • Revert to confidential: Returns a plan to your private draft state (when allowed).
  • Delete: Removes selected plans.

Result: A success banner confirms how many items were updated or skipped.

docs.title: Create a Diary Entry
docs.text:
1. Click New diary entry.
  2. Select the appropriate template if prompted.
  3. Enter the match context and complete the sections provided.
  4. Save as a Draft or Submit as directed.

Result: The entry appears in your list. When reviewed, you can mark it as read.

docs.title: Create a Plan
docs.text:
1. Click New plan entry.
  2. Add goals, actions, and any due dates.
  3. Save your plan; update over time as you progress.

Result: The plan appears in your list. When reviewed, you can mark it as read or archive it later.

docs.title: Create a Peer Review
docs.text: Peer reviews allow you to provide feedback on a colleague's performance (if your association enables this feature).

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• Peer reviews may not be enabled for all associations
  • Check if the New peer review button is visible on your My Assessments page
  • Contact your administrator if you're unsure whether peer reviews are available

docs.title: How to Create a Peer Review
docs.text:
1. On the Assessments page, look for the New peer review button
  2. If the button is greyed out or missing, peer reviews are not enabled for your association
  3. Click New peer review
  4. Select the colleague you want to review
  5. Complete the peer review template (specific fields depend on your association)
  6. Choose how to submit:
  7. Draft: Save privately; you can edit later
  8. Submit for Review: Send to administrators for publication; they can add comments before sharing with the colleague
  9. Click Save

Result: Your peer review is created and appears in your list.

docs.title: After Submission
docs.text:
• Draft peer reviews: Only you can see them
  • Submitted peer reviews: Administrators review and publish before the colleague sees them
  • Published peer reviews: The colleague receives an email notification and can view your feedback
  • Your colleague can then view your feedback in their My Assessments list marked as a peer review

docs.title: Viewing Peer Reviews You Received
docs.text:
When a colleague creates a peer review for you:

  1. You receive an email notification (if enabled)
  2. The peer review appears in your My Assessments list
  3. Open it to see your colleague's feedback
  4. Mark as read to acknowledge you have reviewed it
  5. Your colleague's name is shown as the reviewer

docs.title: View a Review or Assessment
docs.text:
1. Open an item from My Assessments.
  2. Review original notes (Diary/Plan) and any reviewer ratings/comments.
  3. If media is included, download the file or open the shared link (e.g., MOS upload, YouTube, Dropbox, OneDrive).
  4. If prompted, marking it as viewed acknowledges that you have read the review.

Result: The item’s state updates accordingly and may notify your reviewer (where enabled).

docs.title: Export My Data
docs.text:
Download your lists to CSV for your records.

  • Export assessments: Downloads your assessments list.
  • Export plans: Downloads your plans list.

Tip

For larger exports or admin-level raw data, see Group Reporting.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Bulk action skipped: The item’s current state may not allow that action.
  • Media link not working: Try again on a stable connection; some links open in external services.
  • Can’t find my item: Clear filters, check paging, or widen your date range where available.

docs.title: Response States (Assessments & Diary Entries)
docs.text:
Your assessments and diary entries move through different states as they're created, reviewed, and published. Each state controls what you can do with the entry.

State Colour Meaning What You Can Do Confidential Your private draft, not sent for review Edit, delete, submit for review Awaiting Review You submitted it, waiting for admin feedback View only, cannot edit Reviewed Admin published feedback for you to read View, mark as read, revert to confidential (if allowed in group settings) View Only Shared for reading (no feedback included) View, mark as read, revert to confidential (if allowed in group settings) Assessment Assigned to you by an admin View only, cannot delete Draft Assessment Assessment saved as draft (not yet published) View, cannot edit or delete

docs.title: Forgot Password: Recover Your Account
docs.text:
Access Level

Public (before authentication)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Password recovery is a three-step process that sends a reset link to your registered email after you confirm your identity with your secret question.

How to Access: On the sign in page, click Forgot my password

docs.title: Step 1: Identify Account
docs.text:
1. Enter your username or email address.
  2. Click Next.

Validation:

  • Username/email must exist in MOS.
  • If multiple accounts share an email, you may be asked to use your username.

Errors and fixes:

  • "Account not found": Check for typos; try your other email; contact your association.
  • "Too many attempts": Wait a few minutes and try again.

docs.title: Step 2: Secret Question
docs.text:
1. Your saved secret question is displayed.
  2. Enter the secret answer (case-sensitive).
  3. Click Submit.

Tips:

  • Answers are case-sensitive; match your original capitalisation.
  • Remove extra spaces; avoid copy-paste quirks.

Errors and fixes:

  • "Incorrect answer": Try your alternate phrasing; consider case/capitalisation.
  • "No secret question set": Contact your association to reset security settings.

docs.title: Step 3: Reset Email
docs.text:
• A password reset email is sent to your registered email address.
  • The email contains a time-limited link to create a new password.

If the email doesn’t arrive:

  • Check Spam/Junk.
  • Search for the subject like "Reset your Match Official System password".
  • Ask your IT to allowlist the sender domain.

docs.title: After Reset
docs.text:
1. Click the link in the email.
  2. Enter a new password and confirm it.
  3. Submit to complete the reset.

Password rules:

  • Minimum 7 characters.
  • Mix of uppercase, lowercase, and numbers.
  • Symbols recommended.
  • Avoid common words and reuse from other sites.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• No email received: Verify the correct email is on your account via an admin; re-run the flow; check Spam/Junk.
  • Link expired: Re-run the Forgot Password flow to receive a fresh link.
  • Locked out: Too many attempts may temporarily lock recovery; wait and retry.
  • No access to email: Contact your association to update your email.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Set a memorable secret answer and store it securely.
  • ✅ Use a password manager to generate and store strong passwords.
  • ✅ Change your password regularly and avoid reuse.

docs.title: Sign In: Access Your Account
docs.text:
Access Level

Public (before authentication)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Sign in to access your Match Official System account. Enter your username or email and password to proceed.

How to Access: Go to matchofficialsystem.com and the sign-in page appears by default.

Note

If you do not have an account, contact your association administrator for an invitation

docs.title: How to Sign In
docs.text:
1. Go to matchofficialsystem.com
  2. The sign in page appears automatically
  3. Enter your username or email address
  4. Enter your password
  5. Optional: Check Keep me signed in to stay signed in longer
  6. Click Sign In
  7. Result: You are signed in and taken to the Home page

Fields:

  • Username/Email (required): Your username or registered email address
  • Password (required): Your account password
  • Forgot my password: Starts the password recovery flow
  • Register: Visible only if your association allows self-registration (most use invitation links)
  • Keep me signed in (optional): Extends your session on trusted devices

Validation:

  • Both username and password are required
  • Spaces at the beginning and end are removed automatically

Errors:

  • "Invalid username or password": Check for typos; verify Caps Lock is off
  • "Your account is locked": See Account Lockout section below

docs.title: Keep Me Signed In
docs.text:
When you check Keep me signed in, your session lasts longer on the current device.

When to use it:

  • On your personal computer or phone
  • When you use the system frequently

When NOT to use it:

  • On shared computers
  • On public computers
  • When using someone else's device

Security: Uses secure cookies; may extend session lifetime according to group policy.

docs.title: Session Timeout
docs.text:
Your session ends automatically after a period of inactivity to protect your account.

What happens:

  • After 20 to 60 minutes of no activity (varies by association)
  • You may see a prompt asking if you want to extend your session
  • You are automatically signed out if you do not respond
  • Unsaved changes can be lost if your session expires

Tip: Save your work regularly to avoid losing changes when your session ends

docs.title: Account Lockout
docs.text: If you enter the wrong password several times, your account may be temporarily locked for security.

docs.title: If Your Account Is Locked
docs.text:
1. Wait a few minutes before trying again
  2. Use Forgot my password to reset your password
  3. Contact your administrator if you need immediate access

How to Fix: Multiple failed attempts trigger temporary lockout to protect against brute force attacks. After reset, lockouts are cleared.

docs.title: Maintenance Mode
docs.text:
During scheduled maintenance, you may not be able to sign in.

What you see:

  • A maintenance notice on the sign in page
  • A message preventing you from signing in

What to do:

  • Wait and try again later
  • Check association communications for updates

docs.title: Signing Out
docs.text:
When you're finished using the system, sign out to protect your account.

How to Sign Out:

  1. Click your profile name or avatar in the top-right corner
  2. Click Sign Out
  3. Result: You are signed out and return to the sign-in page

docs.title: Can't sign in
docs.text:
1. Use Forgot my password to reset your password
  2. Check your Caps Lock is off
  3. Verify there are no extra spaces before or after your username
  4. Clear your browser cookies and try again

docs.title: Don't know your username
docs.text:
1. Contact your association administrator to confirm your username
  2. Use Forgot my password if you prefer to reset

docs.title: New device not recognised
docs.text:
1. Complete sign-in normally
  2. If prompted, verify your email address
  3. You may need additional verification on first login from a new device

docs.title: Page loops after sign-in
docs.text:
Symptoms: You sign in but return to the login page

How to Fix:

  1. Clear your browser cookies and cache
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Try disabling browser extensions
  4. Contact your administrator if the problem continues

docs.title: Still can't sign in
docs.text:
1. Verify you have an active account with your association
  2. Check your internet connection is stable
  3. Try the system on a different network
  4. Contact your administrator for help

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Use a password manager for strong, unique passwords
  • ✅ Enable email notifications and keep your email updated
  • ✅ Log out from shared devices after each session
  • ❌ Don't use "Keep me signed in" on shared devices
  • ❌ Don't share your password with anyone

docs.title: Register: Create Your Account
docs.text:
Access Level

Public (with invitation link required)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The system uses an invitation-based registration system to ensure only authorised members can create accounts. The registration process involves receiving an invitation link, verifying your email, providing personal information, and completing verification.

How to Access: Click the registration link in your invitation email

Warning

You cannot self-register without an invitation link. Contact your association administrator if you need access

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
Requirements:

  • Valid email address (personal or work)
  • Registration invitation link from your association
  • Access to your email for verification

What You'll Need:

  • First name and surname (legal name preferred)
  • Valid email address that you check regularly
  • Ability to complete a visual CAPTCHA challenge

docs.title: Invitation-Based Access
docs.text:
MOS groups control who can register through invitation links. Your association administrator will:

  • Generate a unique registration link for your group
  • Send it to prospective members via email
  • The link includes your group information and ensures you join the correct organisation

docs.title: Group Association
docs.text:
When you click the registration link, you'll see your association's:

  • Group logo
  • Association name
  • Group description

This confirms you're registering for the correct organisation.

docs.title: Step 1: Receive Invitation
docs.text:
From Your Association:

  1. Your association administrator sends an invitation email

  2. The email contains:

  3. Welcome message

  4. Registration link (unique to your group)
  5. Instructions for getting started

  6. Contact information for support

  7. Click the registration link in the email

  8. Your browser opens the MOS registration page
  9. You'll see your association's branding

What the Link Contains:

  • Group identifier (ensures you join the right organisation)
  • Security token (prevents unauthorised access)

If Your Link Expired:

  • Contact your association administrator
  • Request a new invitation link
  • Links can be regenerated at any time

docs.title: Step 2: Email Verification
docs.text:
Enter Your Email Address:

  1. Email Address field:

  2. Enter your preferred email address

  3. Use an email you check regularly
  4. Can be personal (gmail.com, outlook.com) or work email

  5. Example format: firstname.lastname@company.com

  6. Confirm Email Address field:

  7. Re-enter the exact same email
  8. Must match the first entry character-for-character
  9. Case-sensitive validation

Validation Rules:

  • Email must be valid format: name@domain.com with valid domain
  • Both fields must match exactly
  • Email must not already be registered
  • Maximum 255 characters

Tips:

  • ✅ Copy-paste from first field to second to avoid typos
  • ✅ Use an email address you'll have long-term access to
  • ✅ Avoid temporary or disposable email addresses
  • ✅ Check spam folder if you don't receive confirmation emails

Common Errors:

Error Solution "Email addresses do not match" Carefully re-enter both fields; check for extra spaces "Not a valid email address" Ensure email is in valid format (name@domain.com) "Email already exists" This email is registered; use sign in or password recovery
  1. Click Next to proceed

docs.title: Step 3: Personal Information
docs.text:
Provide Your Name:

  1. First Name field:

  2. Enter your given/first name

  3. Letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes, and periods allowed
  4. Example: Mary-Anne, O'Brien, Jean-Luc

  5. No numbers or special characters (!, @, #, etc.)

  6. Surname field:

  7. Enter your family/last name
  8. Same validation rules as first name
  9. Example: Smith, Van Der Berg, O'Connor

Validation Rules:

  • First Name:

  • Required field

  • Must contain only letters, spaces, commas, periods, hyphens, apostrophes
  • Pattern: ^[A-Za-z ,.'-]+$
  • Minimum 1 character

  • Maximum 50 characters

  • Surname:

  • Required field
  • Same character rules as first name
  • Minimum 1 character
  • Maximum 50 characters

Why We Ask:

  • Your name appears on assessments and reports
  • Administrators use your name to identify you
  • Your name is visible to other members (depending on group settings)
  • Legal name is recommended for official records

Privacy:

  • Your name is visible to your group administrators and other members
  • You can update your name later in Profile settings

  • Some groups may restrict name changes after initial setup

  • Click Next to proceed

docs.title: Step 4: CAPTCHA Verification
docs.text:
Complete Security Challenge:

CAPTCHA verification prevents automated bot registrations and ensures you're a real person.

  1. View the CAPTCHA Image:

  2. An image displays a code (usually 5-7 characters)

  3. Characters may be distorted or overlapping

  4. Background may have noise or patterns

  5. Enter the CAPTCHA Code:

  6. Type the characters you see in the image

  7. Case-sensitive (match uppercase/lowercase exactly)
  8. No spaces before or after

  9. Example: If you see Hg7Kp, enter exactly Hg7Kp

  10. Refresh if Needed:

  11. Can't read the code? Click the refresh icon
  12. A new CAPTCHA image generates
  13. No limit on refresh attempts

Tips:

  • ✅ Take your time reading the code carefully
  • ✅ Watch for similar-looking characters: 0 (zero) vs O (letter O), 1 (one) vs l (lowercase L)
  • ✅ Refresh if the image is too difficult to read
  • ✅ Match the exact case: A ≠ a

Common Issues:

Issue Solution "Incorrect CAPTCHA code" Double-check case and characters; try refreshing for new code Can't read the code Click refresh icon for a clearer image Code too distorted Keep refreshing until you get a readable one
  1. Click Register to submit your registration

docs.title: Completion
docs.text:
Registration Success:

Once you submit your registration:

  1. Confirmation Page Appears:

  2. "You're nearly there" message displays

  3. Confirmation that registration was successful

  4. Instructions to check your email

  5. Email Sent:

  6. Within minutes, you receive a welcome email

  7. Email contains:

    • Username: Your email address or a generated username
    • Temporary Password: A secure auto-generated password
    • Sign-in Link: Direct link to MOS login page
    • Group Information: Your association name and details
    • Next Steps: Instructions for first login

  8. Check Your Email:

  9. Check inbox for email from Match Official System
  10. Subject line: "Welcome to Match Official System"
  11. If not received within 10 minutes, check spam/junk folder

First Sign In:

  1. Click the sign-in link in the email, or go to the MOS login page
  2. Enter:
  3. Username: Your email address
  4. Password: The temporary password from the email
  5. Click Sign in
  6. You'll be prompted to change your password on first login
  7. Set a strong, secure password
  8. Complete your profile setup

What Happens Next:

  • Your account is created in your association's group
  • You're assigned a default User role (can be upgraded by administrators)
  • Your profile is created with basic information
  • You can start completing assessments, viewing news, and accessing resources
  • Association administrators may contact you with onboarding information

docs.title: Registration Link Issues
docs.text:
Problem: Registration link doesn't work or shows an error

Solutions:

  1. Expired Link:

  2. Links may expire after 30-90 days

  3. Contact your association administrator for a new link

  4. They can regenerate invitation links at any time

  5. Invalid Link:

  6. Ensure you copied the entire URL

  7. Check for line breaks if pasted from email

  8. Try clicking the link directly instead of copy-pasting

  9. Group No Longer Exists:

  10. The association may have been deactivated
  11. Contact the administrator who sent the link

docs.title: Email Already Registered
docs.text:
Problem: "The email address you have chosen during the registration process is already in the Match Official System."

What This Means:

  • An account with this email already exists
  • You may have registered previously
  • Someone else may be using this email (unlikely)

Solutions:

  1. Try Signing In:

  2. Go to the sign-in page

  3. Use your email and password

  4. If successful, you already have an account

  5. Forgot Password:

  6. Click "Forgot my password" on the sign-in page

  7. Enter your email address
  8. Answer your secret question

  9. Reset your password

  10. Contact Administrator:

  11. If you don't remember registering, contact your association administrator

  12. They can verify your account status

  13. They may be able to reset your password

  14. Use Different Email:

  15. If you have access to another email address, you can register with that
  16. Update your preferred email in Profile settings after signing in

docs.title: Email Not Received
docs.text:
Problem: Didn't receive the welcome email with login credentials

Solutions:

  1. Check Spam/Junk Folder:

  2. MOS emails may be filtered as spam

  3. Look for sender: an email from the Match Official System

  4. Mark as "Not Spam" and add to contacts

  5. Wait Longer:

  6. Email delivery can take up to 15 minutes

  7. Check again after waiting

  8. Verify Email Address:

  9. Did you enter the correct email?

  10. Check for typos in the email address you registered with

  11. Contact Administrator:

  12. Your association administrator can:
    • Verify your registration status
    • Resend the welcome email
    • Manually set your password
    • Provide your username

docs.title: CAPTCHA Problems
docs.text:
Problem: Can't complete CAPTCHA verification

Solutions:

  1. Refresh for New Code:

  2. Click the refresh icon next to the CAPTCHA image

  3. Keep trying until you get a readable code

  4. Match Case Exactly:

  5. CAPTCHA is case-sensitive

  6. A (uppercase) ≠ a (lowercase)

  7. Avoid Extra Spaces:

  8. Don't add spaces before or after the code

  9. Copy-paste is not allowed; must type manually

  10. Browser Issues:

  11. Try a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)
  12. Clear browser cache and cookies
  13. Disable browser extensions that may interfere

docs.title: Form Validation Errors
docs.text:
Problem: Form won't submit or shows validation errors

Common Issues:

  1. Email Format Invalid:

  2. Must be format: name@domain.com

  3. Check for spaces, missing @, or invalid domain

  4. Emails Don't Match:

  5. Both email fields must be identical

  6. Check for extra spaces or typos

  7. Name Contains Invalid Characters:

  8. Only letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes, periods, commas allowed

  9. No numbers or special characters like @, #, $

  10. Missing Required Fields:

  11. All fields must be completed
  12. Look for red error messages indicating what's missing

docs.title: After Registration
docs.text:
1. Sign in with your new credentials
  2. Change your password: My Account → Change Password
  3. Complete your profile: My Account → Update Profile (add picture, address details, theme)
  4. Explore: Check the Home dashboard, news, and any assigned work
  5. Contact your administrator if you have questions about your access or role

docs.title: Can we start with fewer users and add later?
docs.text: Yes. You can start with one 50‑user block and purchase additional blocks as you grow. Costs are typically pro rata if you add users mid‑year.

docs.title: What happens if we exceed our user limit?
docs.text: Contact your administrator or Cortana Design immediately. You'll need to purchase additional user blocks to continue adding members.

docs.title: Are subgroups required?
docs.text: No. You can operate with no subgroups (everyone in one group). Subgroups are optional and help organise larger associations.

docs.title: Can we customise the number of users per block?
docs.text: Standard pricing uses 50‑user blocks. Contact Cortana Design to discuss custom licensing arrangements.

docs.title: What support is included?
docs.text: Support includes access to this documentation, email support and assistance with technical issues. Premium support may be available for an additional cost.

docs.title: Is there a trial period?
docs.text: Contact Cortana Design to enquire about trial licences or pilot programmes.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Download files and media provided throughout the site. Files are stored in the library or attached to items such as news posts, assessments, and reports.

How to Access: Click a download link or media thumbnail wherever it appears throughout the system

docs.title: Understanding File Links
docs.text:
Files can appear in many places:

  • News articles (news-attached documents)
  • Assessment feedback (evidence and media)
  • Library folders (managed files and folders)
  • Reports (export files)
  • Email notifications (linked resources)

docs.title: Single Click Download
docs.text:
1. Locate the file you want to download
  2. Click the file name
  3. Your browser's download dialog appears
  4. Choose a save location or accept the default (usually Downloads folder)
  5. Click Save or Download
  6. Result: The file downloads to your computer

docs.title: Browser Behavior
docs.text:
Different browsers handle downloads differently:

  • Chrome: Auto-downloads to Downloads folder by default
  • Firefox: Asks where to save or uses Downloads folder
  • Edge: Auto-downloads or asks, depending on settings
  • Safari: Opens download dialog or saves automatically

Tip: Check your browser's download settings to customise where files are saved.

docs.title: Large File Downloads
docs.text:
For files over 10 MB:

  1. Ensure you have a stable internet connection
  2. Use Wi-Fi rather than mobile data if possible
  3. Allow extra time for the download to complete
  4. Do not close your browser until the download is finished

Common Download Sizes:

  • Documents (PDF, Word): 1-5 MB
  • Spreadsheets: 2-10 MB
  • Images and photos: 2-8 MB
  • Video files: 50 MB to 2+ GB
  • Compressed archives (ZIP): Variable

docs.title: Download from News Articles
docs.text:
1. Go to News
  2. Click Read more on an article
  3. Look for attachment links or a download section
  4. Click the file name or Download button
  5. Result: The file downloads

docs.title: Download Assessment Evidence
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments
  2. Open an assessment or review
  3. Look for attached evidence or media files
  4. Click Download next to the file
  5. Result: The file downloads

docs.title: Download from Library (Media or Folders)
docs.text:
1. Go to Library → Folders or Media
  2. Navigate to the file you want
  3. Click the file name or Download button
  4. Result: The file downloads

For multiple files: Select files and click Download Selected to download as a ZIP archive (if enabled).

docs.title: Download Reports or Exports
docs.text:
1. Go to Reporting or an admin report page
  2. Click Export this data to CSV or similar button
  3. A CSV file downloads
  4. Open in Excel, Sheets, or a text editor
  5. Result: You can view, edit, and analyze the data

docs.title: Open Downloaded Files
docs.text:
After downloading, find your file:

  1. Click the browser's Downloads button (⬇️)
  2. Or check your Downloads folder:
  3. Windows: C:\Users\YourName\Downloads
  4. Mac: ~/Downloads
  5. Chromebook: Files app
  6. Double-click the file to open it
  7. The file opens with your default application

docs.title: File Types and Default Applications
docs.text:
• PDF: PDF reader (Adobe, browser, or other)
  • Word (.docx): Microsoft Word or Google Docs
  • Excel (.xlsx): Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
  • Images (.jpg, .png): Image viewer or browser
  • Video: Media player (VLC, Windows Media Player, etc.)
  • ZIP: Archive tool (Windows, Mac, or extraction software)

docs.title: Verify Downloaded Files
docs.text:
Check that your file downloaded completely:

  1. In your Downloads folder, check the file size
  2. Compare to the size shown in MOS (if displayed)
  3. If sizes don't match, re-download the file
  4. Scan downloaded files with antivirus software if from untrusted sources

docs.title: Download button doesn't work
docs.text:
Symptoms: Clicking download does nothing

How to Fix:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Check your browser's pop-up blocker (some block downloads)
  4. Disable browser extensions temporarily and try again
  5. Check your internet connection

Common Causes:

  • Browser compatibility issue
  • Browser security settings
  • Network interruption
  • File temporarily unavailable

docs.title: Permission denied or file not accessible
docs.text:
Symptoms: Error message says you don't have permission or the file doesn't exist

How to Fix:

  1. Verify you have access to the item (news, assessment, folder, etc.)
  2. Check your group membership and permissions
  3. Contact your administrator if you believe you should have access
  4. Try logging out and back in

Common Causes:

  • You don't have access to the group or subgroup
  • Your role doesn't include access to this item
  • File was removed or deleted
  • Sharing link expired

docs.title: File missing or deleted
docs.text:
Symptoms: The download link appears but the file is gone

How to Fix:

  1. Contact your administrator to confirm file location
  2. Ask if the file was archived or moved
  3. Request a new copy if it was recent
  4. Check if there's a backup version available

Common Causes:

  • File was deleted from library
  • File was moved to a different folder
  • Sharing link expired
  • File storage limit exceeded

docs.title: Slow or incomplete download
docs.text:
Symptoms: Download takes very long or stops before completing

How to Fix:

  1. Check your internet connection speed
  2. Try downloading again
  3. Switch from mobile data to Wi-Fi
  4. Use a wired connection instead of wireless
  5. Close other applications using bandwidth
  6. Try downloading at a different time

Common Causes:

  • Slow internet connection
  • Network congestion
  • Large file size
  • Browser timeout

docs.title: Browser warns about unsafe file
docs.text:
Symptoms: Browser shows "This file is unsafe" or similar warning

How to Fix:

  1. This is usually a false positive if the file came from MOS
  2. Click Keep or Download anyway to proceed
  3. Scan the file with antivirus software
  4. If you're concerned, ask your administrator about the file
  5. Never open unknown files from untrusted sources

Common Causes:

  • Executable files (.exe, .zip) may trigger warnings
  • Browser being overly cautious
  • File actually contains malware (rare from MOS)

docs.title: Tips and Best Practices
docs.text:
• ✅ Check file size before downloading on limited connections
  • ✅ Verify downloaded files are what you expected
  • ✅ Scan downloaded files with antivirus if concerned
  • ✅ Organize downloads into folders (Documents, Projects, etc.)
  • ✅ Keep important downloads backed up in another location
  • ❌ Don't open unexpected files from unknown sources
  • ❌ Don't ignore antivirus warnings
  • ❌ Don't download files if you don't recognise their source

docs.title: Groups and Associations
docs.text:
Reference

Understanding organizational structure in Match Official System

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: In Match Official System, a group (or association) is the logical boundary that defines a community of users who officiate a specific sporting code or organization.

docs.title: What Is a Group/Association?
docs.text:
A group is:

  • A sporting organization - Represents a league, federation, association, or governing body for a particular sport
  • A logical boundary for users - Contains all officials, administrators, reviewers, and other members who work for that organization
  • A container for resources - Holds news, assessments, training materials, library files, and reports specific to that organization
  • A permission scope - Controls who can see what data and features based on their role and group membership

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Common examples of groups/associations:

  • Football/Soccer league
  • Rugby union or rugby league organization
  • Cricket association
  • Tennis federation
  • Basketball league
  • Netball association
  • Water polo federation

docs.title: Organizational Structure
docs.text:
Groups can have a hierarchical structure with subgroups:

  • Parent group - The main organization (e.g., National Football League)
  • Subgroups - Divisions, regions, or sections within the parent (e.g., Northern Division, Southern Division)

Members can belong to the parent group and/or specific subgroups. Administrators can organize users into subgroups based on geography, competition level, or other criteria.

docs.title: Data Visibility
docs.text:
• You only see news, announcements, and reports from your group and subgroups
  • You can only interact with users who are members of your group or shared subgroups
  • Your assessments and diaries are scoped to your group

docs.title: Features and Settings
docs.text:
• Group administrators control which features are enabled (e.g., whether News notifications are available)
  • Settings such as the calendar start date, time zone, and quick links are configured per group
  • Theme and branding can be customised per group

docs.title: Access Levels
docs.text:
• Your permission level (User, Viewer, Reviewer, Owner) is specific to each group you belong to
  • You might have different roles in different groups
  • For example, you could be an Owner in one group but a Reviewer in another

docs.title: Levels of Access
docs.text:
Match Official System comes with different levels of access that are controllable by group administrators. This page describes each access level and the permissions granted.

Access Level

Administrator-controlled setting

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Access in the system is role-based. Each role grants specific permissions to features, data, and administrative functions. Access levels are assigned by group administrators when adding members to a group.

docs.title: Access Levels and Permissions
docs.text: The system includes four access levels:

docs.title: User
docs.text:
Description: Standard member access with personal workspace

Permissions:

  • Create diary and plan entries
  • Search users in their group(s)
  • Sit an exam
  • Access folders in their group(s), but restricted to their personal user folder
  • Upload files to personal user folder*

docs.title: Viewer
docs.text:
Description: Read and review access with reporting capabilities

Permissions:

  • Create diary and plan entries
  • Search users in their group(s)
  • Create and assign match day, media, season, and general review entries on a user
  • Run reporting on the group
  • View review history of a user account
  • Sit an exam
  • Access folders in their group(s), but restricted to subgroup(s) if not also a User at that level
  • Upload files to personal user folder*

docs.title: Reviewer
docs.text:
Description: Assessment review and group folder access

Permissions:

  • Create diary and plan entries
  • Search users in their group(s)
  • Create and assign match day, media, season, and general review entries on a user
  • Run reporting on the group
  • View review history of a user account
  • Review diary and plan entries that are awaiting review
  • Sit an exam
  • Access folders in their group(s), but restricted to subgroup(s) if not also a User/Viewer at that level
  • Upload files to all subgroup folders they are a reviewer too

docs.title: Owner
docs.text:
Description: Full administrative control

Permissions:

  • Create diary and plan entries
  • Search users in their group(s)
  • Create and assign match day, media, season, and general review entries on a user
  • Run reporting on the group
  • View review history of a user account
  • Review diary and plan entries that are awaiting review
  • Create, edit, and delete users
  • Modify group settings - disable/enable notifications, enable user registration, etc.
  • Modify assessment templates - customise diary and match day entry templates
  • Manage exam questions and answers
  • Sit an exam
  • Access folders in their group(s) and any subsequent subgroup(s)
  • Upload files to all group folders

docs.title: How folder access is determined
docs.text: Folder permissions are based on your access level and which subgroups you belong to. Some groups may disable personal user folders; if disabled, personal uploads are not available.

docs.title: Role-based folder permissions
docs.text:
User

  • Access only to personal folder: User/{username} (if enabled).
  • Upload and delete files only inside their personal folder.
  • Cannot create, rename, move, or delete folders outside their personal folder.

Viewer

  • Inherits User permissions.
  • Can view subgroup folders they’re assigned to (read-only).
  • Personal uploads allowed only when user folders are enabled.
  • Cannot create, rename, move, or delete folders.

Reviewer

  • Inherits Viewer permissions.
  • Can view and upload to group and subgroup folders they have access to.
  • Cannot create or delete folders (folder creation is reserved for Owners/admins).

Owner

  • Full folder control across the group and its subgroups.
  • Can create, rename, move, and delete folders and files (system-managed folders such as core subgroup and user folder containers may be protected from deletion).
  • Can generate share links for files.

docs.title: Typical folder layout
docs.text:
Home/
├── user/                   (personal user folders, if enabled)
│   ├── john.smith/
│   ├── jane.doe/
│   └── ...
├── subgroups/              (if enabled)
│   ├── Northern Division/
│   ├── Southern Division/
│   └── ...
├── Documents/
├── Photos/
└── Resources/

docs.title: Folder Settings
docs.text:
Group administrators can enable or disable:

  • User Folders: Allow members to have personal storage
  • Subgroup Folders: Organize members into subgroup folders

When disabled, members cannot access or see those folder areas.

docs.title: Permission Hierarchy
docs.text:
Access levels build upon each other:

User (basic) → Viewer (read/review) → Reviewer (all reviews) → Owner (administrative)

Each higher level includes all permissions of lower levels, plus additional capabilities.

docs.title: Can I upload files?
docs.text:
• User: Only to your personal folder
  • Viewer: Only to your personal folder
  • Reviewer: To all group and subgroup folders
  • Owner: To all group and subgroup folders

Access Level

Users with upload/edit permissions

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Folders page is the full-featured file manager for your group's storage. Use it to upload, organize, rename, move, and delete files and folders. For read-only assessment, news and profile picture browsing, see Media.

Capabilities:

  • Create folders and subfolders
  • Upload single or multiple files
  • Rename files and folders
  • Move items between folders
  • Generate secure, time-limited share links
  • Download files (and folders if ZIP download is enabled)
  • Delete files and folders

Permissions:

  • Access varies by role and subgroup.
  • Owners can manage all content; Users typically manage their own uploads.

docs.title: Understanding Folder Access
docs.text: Access to folders is controlled by your user role and group membership. Different roles have different permissions.

docs.title: Access by Role
docs.text:
User Level:

  • Can access and upload to their own personal user folder (User/{your username})
  • Cannot create or delete folders outside their personal folder
  • Cannot delete files outside their personal folder
  • Can only see files they created in their personal folder

Viewer Level:

  • Can access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Can view and download files from subgroup folders if assigned to those subgroups
  • Cannot upload to subgroup folders
  • Cannot create or delete folders

Reviewer Level:

  • Can access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Can view, upload, and download files from all group and subgroup folders
  • Cannot create or delete folders
  • Can manage files they uploaded

Owner Level:

  • Full access to all folders in the group and subgroups
  • Can create folders at any level
  • Can delete folders and files at any level
  • Can move files between folders
  • Can generate share links for any file
  • Unrestricted file management

docs.title: Special Folders
docs.text:
Your group may have special folders depending on configuration:

User Folder:

  • Located at the root level: User/{username}
  • Your personal storage space (if enabled by the group)
  • Only you can upload and delete files here
  • Others cannot access your personal folder

Subgroups Folder:

  • Shows team, regional, or division subfolders (if enabled)
  • Access depends on your subgroup membership
  • Reviewers and Owners can upload to these folders
  • Users and Viewers can only view

docs.title: Breadcrumb
docs.text:
• Shows the current path, e.g., Home > Documents > 2024 > Reports.
  • Click any level to jump there.
  • Use Up to go one level up; Home to return to root.

docs.title: Toolbar
docs.text:
• New Folder: Create a folder in the current path.
  • Upload Files: Choose files or drag-and-drop into the grid.
  • Refresh: Reload the current folder view.
  • Download Selected: Download selected files; folders may download as ZIP (if enabled).
  • Share: Create a temporary share link for the selected file.
  • Rename: Rename the selected file or folder.
  • Move: Move selected items to a different folder.

docs.title: File Grid
docs.text:
• Columns: Select, Type, Name, Size, Modified, Actions.
  • Sort by clicking column headers; folders typically list before files.
  • Right-click an item for a context menu (Open, Download, Rename, Move, Delete, Properties).

docs.title: Navigating Folders
docs.text:
• Double-click a folder to open it.
  • Use breadcrumb segments to jump to any level.
  • Use the browser Back button to return while preserving selection state.

Typical structure:

Home/
├── assessments/
│   ├── 2024/
│   │   └── 12/
│   ├── 2025/
│   │   └── 12/

docs.title: Creating Folders
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the desired parent folder.
  2. Click New Folder.
  3. Enter a name (avoid / \ : * ? " < > |).
  4. Click Create.

Results: The folder is created in the current location. You may automatically navigate into it depending on configuration.

Naming tips:

  • ✅ 2025-Season-Reports, Training Materials
  • ❌ Reports/2025, Data:Files, very long names

docs.title: Upload Button
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the destination folder.
  2. Click Upload Files.
  3. Select one or multiple files.
  4. Click Upload.

docs.title: Drag-and-Drop
docs.text:
• Drag files from your computer into the grid to upload.

During upload:

  • A progress bar shows overall and per-file progress.
  • Large files may take longer; Wi-Fi recommended.

Limits and requirements:

  • Typical per-file limit: 10-50 MB (varies by group).
  • Allowed types: Most standard document, image, video, and archive formats.
  • Blocked types: Executables (.exe), certain scripts, or flagged files.

If a name collision occurs:

  • Choose Overwrite, Keep Both (auto-renamed), or Skip.

docs.title: Rename
docs.text:
1. Select a file/folder.
  2. Click Rename.
  3. Edit the name (keep extensions unchanged), then save.

docs.title: Download
docs.text:
• Select a file and click Download.
  • For multiple files, use Download Selected; may create a ZIP.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: • Open the context menu → Properties to view size, type, dates, uploaded-by, and (if applicable) share link status.

docs.title: Share Links
docs.text:
Share links provide temporary access to a single file without requiring MOS login.

  1. Select one file and click Share.
  2. Choose expiration: 1, 7, or 30 days.
  3. Generate and copy the link.
  4. Send via email or message.

Security:

  • Links are hard to guess and expire automatically.
  • Revocation may require an Owner to intervene.

Best practices:

  • ✅ Use the shortest expiration required.
  • ❌ Avoid posting links publicly.

docs.title: Deleting Items
docs.text:
1. Select one or more files/folders.
  2. Click Delete.
  3. Confirm the permanent deletion.

Deleting folders removes all contents recursively. Consider downloading an archive first if needed.

docs.title: Moving Files and Folders
docs.text:
1. Select items and click Move.
  2. Choose the destination in the folder tree.
  3. Click Move Here.

Notes:

  • You cannot move a folder into itself or its descendants.
  • Conflicts prompt for overwrite, skip, or rename.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Plan a clear and consistent folder structure.
  • Use meaningful file names with dates or versions.
  • Archive older content to reduce clutter.
  • Prefer share links over email attachments.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Upload fails: Check size/type limits, try smaller batches, or a different browser; contact an Owner if storage is full.
  • Missing files: Refresh, verify path, clear filters, or confirm permissions.
  • Share link issues: Ensure it hasn’t expired and the file wasn’t moved/deleted.
  • Permission denied: Ask an Owner to adjust your access.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Organise by season, project, or assessment.
  • ✅ Use breadcrumbs to jump quickly.
  • ✅ Clean up duplicates and old versions regularly.

docs.title: Media: View Files from Your Features
docs.text:
Access Level

All users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Media page is a read-only browser for viewing files and media attached to assessments, news articles, and other system features. This is not a file upload area - it shows media that's been attached to items throughout the system such as:

  • Assessment evidence - Photos, videos, or documents attached to your assessments
  • News attachments - Files included with news articles
  • Profile pictures - Member profile images
  • Assessment templates - Documents linked to assessment reviews
  • Other media associated with features

How to Access: Click Library then Media

What You Can Do:

  • Browse media and files in a hierarchical folder structure
  • View file details (name, size, type, date)
  • Download individual files
  • Generate secure share links for files
  • Navigate to related assessments
  • (Administrators) Clean up unused profile images

What You Cannot Do:

  • ❌ Upload new files (attach files directly to the feature instead - assessments, news, etc.)
  • ❌ Create new folders
  • ❌ Delete or rename files
  • ❌ Move files between folders

docs.title: Understanding the Structure
docs.text:
Media appears in the Media browser when:

  1. Files are attached to assessments (evidence, photos, documents)
  2. Files are attached to news articles
  3. Profile pictures are uploaded by users
  4. Content is shared as part of assessment feedback or reviews

These files are organized by feature type and association, not by direct uploads to a "media folder."

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
Breadcrumb Bar:

  • Shows your current location (e.g., Home > Assessments > 2024)
  • Click any segment to jump to that level
  • Use Up (⬆️) to go up one level
  • Click Home (🏠) to return to the top

docs.title: Viewing Folders
docs.text:
1. Double-click a folder to open it
  2. Or click the folder name and press Enter
  3. Contents load showing files and subfolders
  4. Breadcrumb updates to show your location

docs.title: Viewing Files
docs.text:
File Information:

  • Name: Full filename with extension (e.g., match-report-2024.pdf)
  • Size: File size in KB, MB, or GB
  • Date Modified: When the file was last updated
  • Type Icon: Visual indicator of file type (📄 document, 🖼️ image, 🎥 video, etc.)

File Types You Might See:

  • Documents: PDF, DOCX, DOC, TXT, RTF
  • Spreadsheets: XLSX, XLS, CSV
  • Presentations: PPTX, PPT
  • Images: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP, SVG
  • Videos: MP4, AVI, MOV, WMV
  • Archives: ZIP, RAR
  • Others: Various file types your group has attached

Sorting:

  • Click column headers to sort (Name, Size, Date Modified)
  • Click again to reverse order (ascending ↑ / descending ↓)
  • Folders typically appear before files

docs.title: Empty Folders
docs.text:
If a folder shows "No items in this folder":

  • The folder exists but has no files yet
  • No media has been attached to that feature
  • Or you may not have permission to view all content

docs.title: Single File Download
docs.text:
1. Click the file name
  2. Your browser's download dialog appears
  3. Choose save location or accept default (Downloads folder)
  4. Click Save or Download
  5. Result: File downloads to your computer

docs.title: Browser Download Behavior
docs.text:
• Chrome: Auto-downloads to Downloads folder
  • Firefox: Asks where to save or uses Downloads folder
  • Edge: Auto-downloads or asks, depending on settings
  • Safari: Opens download dialog or saves automatically

For Large Files (over 10 MB):

  • Allow extra time for download to complete
  • Use Wi-Fi rather than mobile data if possible
  • Do not close your browser until download finishes

After Downloading:

  1. Check your browser's Downloads folder
  2. Open the file with appropriate software
  3. The file is a copy; original remains in the Media browser

docs.title: Troubleshooting Downloads
docs.text:
Download button doesn't work:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Check if browser pop-up blocker is enabled
  4. Disable browser extensions temporarily

Permission denied error:

  1. Verify you have access to the item (news, assessment, etc.)
  2. Check your group membership
  3. Log out and back in
  4. Contact your administrator if access should be granted

File missing:

  1. File may have been removed
  2. Sharing link may have expired
  3. Contact your administrator

docs.title: Create a Share Link
docs.text:
Share links allow you to provide access to specific files without requiring recipients to sign in.

How to Create:

  1. Select the file you want to share (click once to highlight)
  2. Click the Share button in the toolbar
  3. Share Link Modal opens

Choose Link Expiration:

  • 1 Day: Link expires after 24 hours
  • 7 Days: Link expires after one week (recommended)

  • 30 Days: Link expires after one month

  • Click Generate Link or Create Share Link

  • A unique URL is generated
  • Click Copy to Clipboard or manually copy the URL

docs.title: Sharing the Link
docs.text:
• Paste into email, chat, or message
  • Recipients click the link to download the file
  • No MOS account required (during validity period)
  • Link expires automatically after the chosen period

What Recipients See:

  • Download page with file name and size
  • Download button to get the file
  • Expiration date
  • No access to other files or your library

Security Best Practices:

  • ✅ Use shortest expiration that meets your needs
  • ✅ Only share links with intended recipients
  • ✅ Avoid posting links publicly
  • ✅ Generate new link rather than re-sharing old ones
  • ❌ Don't share links in public forums or social media

docs.title: Revoking Links
docs.text:
If you need to revoke a link before expiration:

  • Contact your administrator
  • They can manually revoke specific links
  • Link immediately becomes invalid

docs.title: View Assessment Evidence
docs.text:
Some folders in Media contain files linked to assessments:

How to Find:

  1. Navigate to the assessments folder in Media
  2. Look for a View Assessment link or button
  3. Click to open the full assessment with all details and evidence

What You'll See:

  • Original assessment details
  • Reviewer feedback (if reviewed)
  • All attached media (photos, videos, documents)
  • Rating scales and comments

Downloading Evidence:

  1. Open the assessment
  2. Look for attachment links or download buttons
  3. Click to download the file
  4. Results appear in your Downloads folder

docs.title: Profile Images Cleanup
docs.text: Admin only: This feature is restricted to Owners and Administrators.

docs.title: Unused Profile Images
docs.text:
Over time, your MOS group may accumulate profile images for users who no longer exist or have changed their profile picture multiple times, leaving orphaned image files.

What This Tool Does:

  • Scans the media library for profile image files
  • Identifies images not currently assigned to any user profile
  • Allows bulk deletion of these orphaned images

Access the Tool:

  1. Navigate to Library → Media
  2. (Admins only) Admin Tools panel appears
  3. Click Profile Images Cleanup or Clean Unused Profile Images

Review Orphaned Images:

  1. A list of unused profile images appears:

  2. Image thumbnail

  3. File name
  4. File size
  5. Upload date

  6. "Not in use" indicator

  7. Select images to delete (checkboxes)

  8. Or Select All to delete all unused images

Delete Images:

  1. Click Delete Selected or Remove Unused Images
  2. Confirmation prompt appears: "Are you sure? This cannot be undone."
  3. Confirm to permanently delete

Results:

  • Selected images are removed from the media library
  • Storage space is freed
  • No impact on current user profiles (only orphaned files are removed)
  • Success message shows how many images were deleted

When to Use:

  • Storage space is running low
  • Performing regular media library maintenance
  • After bulk user deletions or profile migrations
  • To clean up old test accounts

Caution:

  • ⚠️ Deletion is permanent - images cannot be recovered
  • ⚠️ Ensure images are truly orphaned before deleting
  • ⚠️ If in doubt, do not delete - orphaned images don't cause harm
  • ⚠️ Consider downloading a backup before bulk deleting

Tips:

  • ✅ Run cleanup quarterly or annually as part of maintenance
  • ✅ Review list carefully before bulk delete
  • ✅ Only delete if storage is a concern; orphaned images are harmless
  • ❌ Don't delete images that might be in use elsewhere (linked in news, assessments, etc.)

docs.title: Can't See Expected Files
docs.text:
Problem: Files or folders are missing from the media library

Solutions:

  1. Check Your Location:

  2. Verify you're in the correct folder (check breadcrumb)

  3. Navigate to parent folder and look for subfolder

  4. Refresh the View:

  5. Click Refresh button to reload folder contents

  6. Files may have been added since you opened the page

  7. Permissions:

  8. You may not have permission to view certain folders or files

  9. Contact your administrator if you think you should have access

  10. Subgroup Visibility:

  11. Some files may be restricted to specific subgroups

  12. Check with administrator about subgroup assignments

  13. Files May Be in Folders (not Media):

  14. Media is read-only view; some content may only be in Folders page
  15. Try Library → Folders instead

docs.title: Download Doesn't Start
docs.text:
Problem: Clicking download doesn't download the file

Solutions:

  1. Browser Blocked Download:

  2. Check browser's download/popup blocker

  3. Allow downloads from MOS domain

  4. Try again

  5. File Too Large:

  6. Large files may time out

  7. Try a wired connection or better Wi-Fi

  8. Contact admin if file is too large for normal download

  9. Browser Compatibility:

  10. Try a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)

  11. Update your current browser to latest version

  12. Network Issues:

  13. Check your internet connection
  14. Try again later if network is slow

docs.title: Share Link Doesn't Work
docs.text:
Problem: Generated share link shows error or doesn't load

Solutions:

  1. Link Expired:

  2. Check expiration date

  3. Generate a new link if needed

  4. Link Copied Incorrectly:

  5. Ensure entire URL was copied (check for truncation)

  6. Re-copy from share modal

  7. Permissions Changed:

  8. File may have been deleted or moved

  9. Permissions may have been revoked

  10. Generate new link

  11. Recipient Issues:

  12. Recipient may have network/browser issues
  13. Ask them to try different browser or device

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
For All Users:

  • ✅ Use breadcrumb navigation to jump between folders quickly
  • ✅ Sort by Date Modified to find recent uploads
  • ✅ Generate short-lived share links (1-7 days) for better security
  • ✅ Download files for offline access when needed
  • ✅ Use Folders page for upload/edit operations (Media is read-only)

  • ✅ Monitor storage usage and advise users to delete old files

docs.title: About Match Official System Licensing
docs.text: Match Official System is an annual subscription service provided by Cortana Design. Associations and organisations purchase annual (or seasonal) licences to use the system, which includes access for all members and features.

docs.title: Pricing
docs.text:
Annual subscription pricing ranges from approximately $500 to $1,500 AUD per year (or per season), depending on factors such as:

  • Number of users in your organisation
  • Number of subgroups you require
  • Feature packages selected

docs.title: How Users and Subgroups Are Priced
User Licensing
docs.text:
Users are purchased in blocks of 50

  • Minimum: 50 users
  • Additional blocks can be purchased as needed
  • Covers all members who need access to the system
  • All user types (Users, Viewers, Reviewers, Owners) count towards this limit

docs.title: Subgroup Licensing
docs.text:
Subgroups are purchased in blocks of 5

  • Minimum: 5 subgroups (or the subscription includes a base allocation)
  • Additional blocks can be purchased for more divisions/regions/teams
  • Each subgroup helps organise members and control feature access
  • Allows targeting of news, resources and assessments

docs.title: Included Features
docs.text:
All features except subgroup enhancements are available with your subscription:

  • ✅ Dashboard and personal workspace
  • ✅ Profile management
  • ✅ News and announcements
  • ✅ Assessments and reviews
  • ✅ Exams and question banks
  • ✅ File storage and library
  • ✅ Media management
  • ✅ Reporting and analytics
  • ✅ User management (Owners only)
  • ✅ Group settings and configuration
  • ✅ Assessment templates
  • ✅ Email notifications

docs.title: Subgroup Enhancements
docs.text:
Subgroup-related features:

  • Create and organise subgroups
  • Target news to specific subgroups
  • Assign users to subgroups
  • Control access based on subgroup membership
  • Organise assessments by subgroup
  • Generate subgroup-specific reports

docs.title: Determining User Count
docs.text:
Count all members who need access:

  • Match officials who create and submit assessments
  • Reviewers who assess and provide feedback
  • Administrators who manage the system
  • Support staff who may need read-only access
  • New members who will join during the subscription period

Plan for growth: purchase additional user blocks if you expect to grow during the subscription year.

docs.title: Determining Subgroup Count
docs.text:
Consider your organisational structure:

  • No subgroups: One flat organisation
  • By region: Regional divisions (e.g. North, South, East, West)
  • By level: Competitive levels (e.g. Professional, Semi‑Professional, Amateur)
  • By sport/code: Different sports within one organisation
  • By committee: Management committees with different roles
  • Hybrid: A mix of different organisational structures

Example: A state-level sporting body with 5 regions might purchase:

  • 150 users (3 blocks of 50)
  • 10 subgroups (2 blocks of 5) for regions and central administration

docs.title: Annual Renewal
docs.text:
• Subscriptions are annual, aligned with your financial year or season
  • Renewal costs depend on updated user and subgroup counts
  • Plan ahead to adjust licences before renewal
  • Contact Cortana Design for renewal and modifications

docs.title: Adjusting User Counts
docs.text:
If you need more users:

  • Contact Cortana Design to add additional blocks
  • May be added mid‑year (charges pro rata)
  • Removed users free up slots for new members

docs.title: Adjusting Subgroup Counts
docs.text:
If you need more subgroups:

  • Contact Cortana Design to add additional blocks
  • Existing subgroups can be reorganised without additional cost
  • Removed subgroups don't reduce the subscription cost

docs.title: Invoice and Billing
docs.text:
• Annual invoices are sent based on your subscription term
  • Payment terms are negotiated per organisation
  • Contact Cortana Design for billing enquiries

docs.title: Support and Assistance
docs.text:
For questions about your subscription:

  • Contact your association administrator
  • Reach out to Cortana Design directly
  • Check this documentation for feature explanations

docs.title: Small Organisation
docs.text:
50 users

  • Single subscription: ~$500/year
  • All features included
  • May eventually need subgroups as you grow

100-150 users

  • 3 user blocks (150 users): ~$1,000/year
  • 1 subgroup block (5 subgroups): additional cost
  • Total: ~$1,100-1,200/year

docs.title: Understanding the News Page

docs.title: How to Read an Article

docs.title: Change Password: Update Your Login Credentials
docs.text:
Access Level

All authenticated users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Change your login password and set up a secret question for account recovery if you forget your password.

How to Access: Click My Account then Change password

Note

First-time users will see a welcome screen before accessing the password change form

docs.title: How to Change Your Password
docs.text:
1. Click My Account → Change password
  2. Enter your Current Password
  3. Enter your New Password
  4. Re-enter your new password in Confirm Password
  5. Click Save
  6. Confirmation: You'll see a success message confirming your password was updated

You'll remain logged in after changing your password - no need to log in again.

docs.title: Password Fields
docs.text:
Current Password (required)

  • Your existing password
  • Confirms your identity before allowing changes

New Password (required)

  • Your new desired password
  • Must meet security requirements (see below)

Confirm Password (required)

  • Re-enter your new password to prevent typos
  • Must match New Password exactly

docs.title: Password Requirements
docs.text:
Your new password must meet these criteria:

  • Minimum length: At least 7 characters
  • Uppercase letters: Include at least one (A-Z)
  • Lowercase letters: Include at least one (a-z)
  • Numbers: Include at least one (0-9)
  • Special characters: Recommended (!, @, #, $, %, etc.)

Creating a Strong Password:

  • ✅ Use a unique password for this system
  • ✅ Mix uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters
  • ✅ Avoid personal information (birthdays, names, etc.)
  • ✅ Don't reuse old passwords
  • ✅ Consider using a password manager to generate and store passwords
  • ✅ Change your password every 90 days

Avoid:

  • ❌ Common words or phrases
  • ❌ Sequential numbers (123456)
  • ❌ Keyboard patterns (qwerty)
  • ❌ Personal information easily found online
  • ❌ Sharing your password with anyone

docs.title: Secret Question Setup
docs.text: Set up a secret question and answer to recover your account if you forget your password.

docs.title: How to Set Up Your Secret Question
docs.text:
1. Create Your Question:

  2. Enter a question in the Secret Question field

  3. Make it something only you would know

  4. Avoid questions with answers on social media

  5. Provide Your Answer:

  6. Enter the answer in the Secret Answer field

  7. Remember the exact spelling and capitalization

  8. Keep it private - don't share with anyone

  9. Click Save

  10. Confirmation: Your secret question is now set up

docs.title: Choosing a Good Secret Question
docs.text:
Good Examples:

  • "What was the name of your first childhood friend?"
  • "What street did you grow up on?"
  • "What city were your parents born in?"
  • "What was your childhood nickname?"

What Makes a Good Question:

  • ✅ Something you'll always remember
  • ✅ Answer won't change over time
  • ✅ Not publicly available information
  • ✅ Specific enough to be unique to you

Avoid:

  • ❌ Questions with answers on Facebook/social media
  • ❌ Questions with changing answers (current car, favourite movie)
  • ❌ Questions with obvious answers
  • ❌ Information in public records

Answer Tips:

  • ✅ Remember exact capitalization (answer is case-sensitive)
  • ✅ Remember exact spelling
  • ✅ Don't use common misspellings
  • ✅ Keep it simple enough to type correctly under stress

docs.title: How to Update Your Secret Question
docs.text:
If you've already set a secret question and want to change it:

  1. The current question will be displayed
  2. Edit the Secret Question field with your new question
  3. Enter the new answer in Secret Answer
  4. Click Save
  5. Confirmation: Your secret question has been updated

docs.title: Using Your Secret Question
docs.text:
If you forget your password:

  1. Go to the login page
  2. Click Forgot Password
  3. Enter your username or email
  4. Your secret question will be displayed
  5. Enter your answer exactly as you set it (case-sensitive)
  6. If correct, you'll be able to reset your password

docs.title: Changing an Expired Password
docs.text:
If your password has expired or an administrator requires you to change it:

  1. You'll be redirected to the Change Password page automatically
  2. Enter your Current Password
  3. Enter a New Password meeting the requirements
  4. Confirm your new password
  5. Click Save
  6. You'll be able to access the system normally

docs.title: Recovering Access After Forgetting Password
docs.text:
1. Click Forgot Password on the login page
  2. Enter your username/email
  3. Answer your secret question
  4. Follow the prompts to create a new password
  5. Log in with your new password

docs.title: "Current password incorrect"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Check that Caps Lock is off
  2. Verify you're typing the password correctly
  3. Try typing it in a text editor first to see what you're entering
  4. If you can't remember your password, use Forgot Password on the login page

docs.title: "New passwords do not match"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Clear both the New Password and Confirm Password fields
  2. Type your new password carefully in New Password
  3. Type the exact same password in Confirm Password
  4. Make sure there are no extra spaces at the beginning or end

docs.title: "Password does not meet requirements"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Make sure your password is at least 7 characters long
  2. Include at least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
  3. Include at least one lowercase letter (a-z)
  4. Include at least one number (0-9)
  5. Consider adding a special character (!, @, #, $, etc.)

Example of a strong password: MyPass24!

docs.title: Secret Question Shows "REMOVED"
docs.text:
What This Means: Your previous secret question was removed for security reasons.

How to Fix:

  1. Enter a new question in Secret Question
  2. Enter your answer in Secret Answer
  3. Click Save
  4. Your new secret question is now active

docs.title: Can't Remember Secret Answer
docs.text:
What to Try:

  1. The answer is case-sensitive - try different capitalizations
  2. Check for spelling variations you might have used
  3. If you still can't remember, contact an administrator for a password reset

docs.title: Password Security
docs.text:
• ✅ Change your password every 90 days
  • ✅ Use a different password for this system than other websites
  • ✅ Never share your password with anyone
  • ✅ Don't write your password on sticky notes
  • ✅ Use a password manager to remember complex passwords
  • ✅ Log out from shared computers

docs.title: Secret Question Security
docs.text:
• ✅ Choose a question with an answer only you know
  • ✅ Don't share your answer with anyone
  • ✅ Remember the exact way you typed your answer
  • ✅ Update your secret question if the answer becomes public knowledge

docs.title: Account Protection
docs.text:
• ✅ If you see unexpected login activity, change your password immediately
  • ✅ Report suspicious activity to an administrator
  • ✅ Don't save your password in browsers on public computers
