docs.title: Profile Management: Your Account Overview
docs.text:
Access Level

All authenticated users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Your profile is your personal space in the Match Official System where you manage all your account settings, personal information, and preferences.

How to Access: Click My Account then Update Profile

docs.title: Accessing Your Profile
docs.text:
1. Log in to Match Official System
  2. Click My Account → Update Profile
  3. The Update Profile page opens showing your profile information and sections you can edit

docs.title: Profile Overview
docs.text:
Your profile page displays:

  • Profile Picture - A circular profile photo
  • Full Name - Your registered name
  • Email Address - Your contact email
  • Group Associations - Logos of groups or associations you belong to
  • Action Buttons:
  • Remove Image
  • Update Image
  • Delete My Account

docs.title: Upload a Profile Picture
docs.text:
1. Click the Update Image button (camera icon)
  2. A modal dialog will open with an upload interface
  3. Select an image file from your computer
  4. Confirm the upload
  5. The image will be cropped to a circular format

docs.title: Requirements for Profile Pictures
docs.text:
• Formats Supported: JPG, PNG, GIF
  • Size: Recommended maximum 5MB
  • Dimensions: Square images work best (will be cropped to a circle)
  • Content: Use a professional, clear headshot or portrait

docs.title: Remove Your Profile Picture
docs.text:
1. Click the Remove Image button (X icon)
  2. Your profile picture will be removed and replaced with a default avatar
  3. You can upload a new image anytime

docs.title: Multi-Group Profile Pictures
docs.text: If you belong to multiple groups or associations, you can have different profile pictures for each group. A small info icon will appear indicating this feature.

docs.title: About Me Section
docs.text: Share a brief biography or introduction with other members:

docs.title: Edit Your About Me
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the About Me section
  2. Click in the text editor
  3. Write a brief description of yourself (100-500 words recommended)
  4. Format your text using the rich text editor:
  5. Bold and Italic text
  6. Lists and formatting
  7. Links to external resources
  8. Click Save

Tips:

  • Be professional and welcoming
  • Mention your role, interests, and experience
  • This appears on your public profile to other group members

docs.title: Profile Details
docs.text: The Profile Details section stores additional personal information:

docs.title: Shirt Size
docs.text:
Enter your shirt size (e.g., S, M, L, XL, XXL). This may be used for:

  • Merchandise ordering
  • Event coordination
  • Uniform requirements

docs.title: Pants Size
docs.text: Enter your pants size (e.g., 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 40). Used for similar purposes as shirt size.

docs.title: Joined Your Group
docs.text: Select the year or date you joined your current group or association from the dropdown list.

docs.title: Occupation / Job
docs.text: Enter your current job title or occupation. This helps colleagues understand your role and background.

docs.title: Email Preferences
docs.text:
Unsubscribe from MOS Automated Emails

Control which automatic system emails you receive:

  • No (default) - Receive all automated emails including:
  • Diary reviewed notifications
  • Diary viewed notifications
  • Assessment updates
  • Group announcements
  • Yes - Stop receiving automated emails (you can still receive direct messages)

docs.title: Notification Preferences
docs.text: Choose which emails you receive and how often.

docs.title: Email Notifications
docs.text:
• Assessment updates (assigned, due soon, results available)
  • Group announcements and resources
  • Account activity alerts

docs.title: Frequency
docs.text:
• Immediate, Daily digest, Weekly digest, or Never

How to update:

  1. Open My Account → Update Profile.
  2. Find Email Preferences or Notifications.
  3. Select the types and frequency you want.
  4. Click Save Preferences.

docs.title: Your Address
docs.text: Your address information is used for official correspondence and event coordination. The system supports multiple address formats.

docs.title: 1. Default Address Format
docs.text:
Standard street address entry:

  • House Number (required)
  • Street Name (required)
  • Street Type - e.g., Street (St), Avenue (Ave), Road (Rd), Drive (Dr), etc.
  • Address Line 2 (optional)

docs.title: 2. Townhouse, Unit or Flat Format
docs.text:
For multi-unit properties:

  • House Number (required)
  • Street Name (required)
  • Street Type (required)
  • Unit/Flat Number
  • Address Line 2 (optional)

docs.title: 3. PO Box Format
docs.text:
For postal box addresses:

  • PO Box Number
  • City/Suburb
  • Additional fields as needed

docs.title: Address Fields
docs.text:
House Number (required)

  • Enter the street number
  • Can include letters and numbers (e.g., 123, 456A, 789/1)
  • Maximum 8 characters

Street Name (required)

  • Full street name without the type
  • Maximum 50 characters
  • Example: "King Edward"

Street Type (required)

  • Select from a comprehensive dropdown list
  • Common types: St, Ave, Rd, Dr, Lane, Cres, Ct, Pl, Way, etc.
  • Over 50 street types available

Address Line 2 (optional)

  • Secondary address information
  • Example: "Apartment 5B" or "Suite 200"

City/Suburb (required)

  • Your suburb or city name
  • Maximum 50 characters

State (required)

  • Your state or province abbreviation
  • Maximum 3 characters
  • Examples: NY, CA, TX, QLD, NSW, VIC, etc.

Zip/Postcode (required)

  • Your postal code
  • Maximum 4 characters (for Australian postcodes)
  • Adjust for your country's code length

Country (required)

  • Your country name
  • Maximum 50 characters
  • Examples: "Australia", "United States", "Canada", etc.

docs.title: Contact Numbers
docs.text:
Phone Number (required)

  • Primary phone contact
  • Accepts digits, +, spaces, and hyphens
  • Example: "+61 2 1234 5678" or "02 1234 5678"

Work Number (optional)

  • Alternative work phone number
  • Same format as phone number

Secondary Number (optional)

  • Additional contact number (mobile, alternative)
  • Same format as phone number

docs.title: Saving Address Information
docs.text:
1. Select your preferred address format
  2. Fill in all required fields (marked with *)
  3. Complete all optional fields if applicable
  4. Click Save
  5. The system will validate your information
  6. A confirmation message will appear once saved

docs.title: Address Validation
docs.text:
The system validates:

  • Required fields are completed
  • Phone numbers contain only valid characters
  • State and country contain only letters and hyphens
  • House numbers contain only valid characters
  • All entries match expected format

If validation fails, error messages will appear above the save button.

docs.title: Privacy and Visibility
docs.text: Control who can see your profile and where you appear.

docs.title: Profile Visibility
docs.text:
• Public
  • Group Members Only
  • Managers Only
  • Private

docs.title: Discoverability
docs.text:
• Show in directory searches
  • Show in group member lists
  • Include in administrative reports

How to update:

  1. Open My Account → Update Profile.
  2. Find Privacy or Visibility.
  3. Choose your preferences and click Save.

docs.title: Theme Selection
docs.text: Customise the appearance of the MOS interface:

docs.title: Available Themes
docs.text:
Click on theme thumbnails to preview different colour schemes.

Notes:

  • Names and exact colours may vary by configuration.
  • Themes represent different colour palettes for the interface.

docs.title: Applying a Theme
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Theme section
  2. Click on the theme image you prefer
  3. The theme will apply immediately to your interface
  4. Your selection is saved automatically

docs.title: Theme Preferences
docs.text:
Your theme preference:

  • Applies to your account only
  • Syncs across all sessions
  • Does not affect other users
  • Can be changed anytime

docs.title: Language and Time Zone
docs.text: Set regional preferences for dates, times, and interface language.

docs.title: Language
docs.text:
• Choose your preferred language (where available)
  • The interface reloads in the selected language

docs.title: Time Zone
docs.text: • Select your time zone so dates/times match your region

docs.title: Number and Date Format
docs.text:
• Choose date format (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY)
  • Choose 12-hour or 24-hour time

How to update:

  1. Open My Account → Update Profile.
  2. Find Language or Regional settings.
  3. Select options and click Save.

docs.title: Accessibility
docs.text: Improve readability and navigation.

docs.title: Font Size
docs.text: • Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large

docs.title: High Contrast Mode
docs.text: • Increases contrast for easier reading

docs.title: Keyboard Navigation
docs.text:
• Navigate using Tab and arrow keys; press Enter to activate buttons

How to update:

  1. Open My Account → Update Profile.
  2. Find Accessibility.
  3. Choose options and click Save.

docs.title: Event Log
docs.text: Your activity log shows all major events on your account:

docs.title: Viewing Your Event Log
docs.text:
The event log displays:

  • Event - Description of the action (login, profile update, etc.)
  • Date/Time - When the event occurred

docs.title: Types of Events
docs.text:
• Account login (if enabled)
  • Profile information updates
  • Picture changes
  • Preference changes
  • Assessment activity
  • Group changes

docs.title: Showing Login Events
docs.text:
By default, login events may be hidden. To view them:

  1. Scroll to the Event Log section
  2. Check the box "Show login events"
  3. Login events will now appear in the log
  4. Uncheck to hide them again

docs.title: Event Log Information
docs.text:
• Events are displayed in reverse chronological order (newest first)
  • The log is paginated (15 events per page)
  • Dates are shown relative to now (e.g., "2 hours ago", "3 days ago")
  • Dates in the past are shown in format "Mon, 15 Dec 2024 10:30"

docs.title: Deleting Your Account
docs.text: Warning: This action is permanent and cannot be undone.

docs.title: Account Deletion Process
docs.text:
1. Click the Delete My Account button (trash icon)
  2. A confirmation dialog will appear with the message:

    "By clicking the button below your MOS account, along with all its data will be deleted. Deleting your account and its data is irreversible."

  3. Read the warning carefully
  4. Click "Delete my account and all its data" to confirm
  5. You will be immediately logged out
  6. All your data will be permanently removed from the system

docs.title: Before Deleting Your Account
docs.text:
Consider:

  • Export any important data or reports you need
  • Notify your group administrator
  • Ensure you have backed up any information
  • Contact your administrator if you only want to pause your membership

docs.title: After Account Deletion
docs.text:
• You cannot log back in with your credentials
  • All assessments, reviews, and media associated with your account will be deleted
  • Your group will no longer have access to your information
  • To rejoin, contact your administrator for a new account

docs.title: Best Practices for Profile Management
docs.text:
• ✅ Keep information current - update address, phone numbers, and job title
  • ✅ Use professional photos - upload a clear, recognizable headshot
  • ✅ Complete your biography - summarize your background and expertise
  • ✅ Review permissions - confirm email preferences and visibility settings
  • ✅ Verify contact information - ensure accuracy for official correspondence
  • ✅ Monitor your event log - watch for unauthorized or unexpected activity

docs.title: Profile Picture Won't Upload
docs.text:
• Check file size (under 5MB recommended)
  • Ensure file format is JPG, PNG, or GIF
  • Try a different image
  • Clear your browser cache and try again

docs.title: Address Validation Errors
docs.text:
• Ensure all required fields are completed
  • Check for valid characters in each field
  • Phone numbers should contain only numbers, +, spaces, and hyphens
  • Country and state should use letters and hyphens only

docs.title: Changes Not Saving
docs.text:
• Ensure all required fields are filled
  • Click the Save button for each section
  • Wait for the confirmation message
  • Refresh the page to verify changes were saved

docs.title: Account Deletion Issues
docs.text:
• Ensure you're logged in with the correct account
  • Verify you want to delete (this cannot be reversed)
  • Contact your administrator if you cannot complete deletion

docs.title: Search Users
docs.text:
Access Level

User, Viewer, Reviewer, Owner

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The search function lets members quickly locate people in their organisation or groups. Use the search bar (top right of any page) to find users by first name, last name or full name; results return match-ranked profile cards that respect group privacy and user sharing settings. Depending on your access level and group configuration, results may include contact details, phone numbers and addresses, or only basic name and avatar information.

docs.title: How to Search for Users
docs.text:
1. Look for the search bar at the top right of any page
  2. Type a person's name (first name, last name, or both)
  3. Click the search icon
  4. View the search results below

What You Can Search:

  • First name
  • Last name
  • Full name (first and last)

Search Tips:

  • You don't need to type the full name
  • Search is not case-sensitive (john finds John)
  • Partial names work (smi finds Smith)
  • Try last name if first name doesn't work

docs.title: Understanding Search Results
docs.text:
Each search result shows a card with the person's information:

Profile Picture

  • Member's photo (if they've uploaded one)
  • Default avatar if no photo

Name

  • Full name (first and last)
  • Clickable to view more details (if available)

Email Address

  • Primary email for contact
  • Click to send an email

Phone Numbers (if available and shared)

  • Primary phone
  • Work phone
  • Secondary phone

Address (if available and shared)

  • Street address
  • Suburb, State, Postcode
  • Country

Note

Not all information may be visible depending on privacy settings and group configuration.

docs.title: What Information You See
docs.text:
The information displayed depends on:

  • Group settings - Your organisation's privacy configuration
  • User preferences - What the member has chosen to share
  • Your permissions - Your access level in the system

docs.title: Full Information Mode
docs.text:
If your group allows full directory access, you'll see:

  • Profile picture
  • Full name
  • Email address
  • Phone numbers
  • Full address

docs.title: Limited Information Mode
docs.text:
If your group has restricted directory access, you'll see:

  • Profile picture
  • Full name only

Note

Administrators and system accounts may be hidden from search results.

docs.title: Finding a Specific Person
docs.text:
1. Know their first or last name
  2. Type it in the search bar at the top right of any page
  3. Press Enter
  4. Scroll through results to find them

docs.title: Getting Someone's Email
docs.text:
1. Search for the person's name
  2. Find their card in the search results
  3. Look for the email address on their card
  4. Click the email to open your email client
  5. Send your message

docs.title: Finding Contact Information
docs.text:
1. Search for the person
  2. View their result card
  3. Email: Click the email address to send a message
  4. Phone: Call the phone number shown
  5. Address: Use the address if you need to mail something

docs.title: Viewing Someone's Profile Picture
docs.text:
1. Search for the person
  2. Their profile picture appears at the top of their result card
  3. If no picture is uploaded, you'll see a default avatar

docs.title: No Results Found
docs.text:
Possible Reasons:

  • Name is spelled differently than you think
  • Person is not in your group
  • Person's account is inactive or deleted
  • Administrator has hidden their account

What to Try:

  1. Check your spelling
  2. Try just the first name or just the last name
  3. Try a nickname if you know it
  4. Ask a colleague for the correct spelling
  5. Contact an administrator if you can't find someone you expect to see

docs.title: Limited Information Displayed
docs.text:
Why This Happens: Your organisation has configured the directory for privacy.

What You Can Do:

  • Contact the person directly if you have another way to reach them
  • Ask an administrator for contact information
  • Request your organisation enable full directory access

docs.title: Profile Pictures Not Loading
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Wait a moment - pictures load progressively
  2. Refresh the page
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. Try a different browser
  5. Contact support if pictures consistently don't load

docs.title: Person You're Looking For Doesn't Appear
docs.text:
Possible Reasons:

  1. Not in your group: They may be in a different organisation
  2. Account inactive: Their account may be disabled
  3. Hidden by admin: System accounts are often hidden
  4. Different spelling: Try variations of their name

What to Do:

  • Ask an administrator to verify the person has an active account
  • Confirm they're in the same organisation/group as you
  • Try alternative name spellings or nicknames

docs.title: Effective Searching
docs.text:
• Start with just a last name for common first names
  • Try both "Michael" and "Mike" for nicknames
  • Use partial names if you're unsure of spelling
  • Check capitalisation doesn't matter

docs.title: Respecting Privacy
docs.text:
• Use contact information appropriately
  • Don't share others' contact details without permission
  • Respect that some information may be intentionally private
  • Follow your organisation's communication policies

docs.title: When to Contact an Administrator
docs.text:
• Can't find someone who should be in the system
  • Need contact information not shown in search
  • Believe there's an error in someone's information
  • Need to update directory privacy settings for your group

  • Change Password - Update your password and secret question

How to Access: Use the search bar at the top right of any page

docs.title: Update Email Address
docs.text:
Access Level

All authenticated users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Change your primary email address or add a secondary email for notifications. Your primary email is used for login and account correspondence.

How to Access: Click My Account then Update email address

Important

Changing your primary email requires your current password to authorize the change. Secondary emails are optional and don't require a password.

docs.title: Change Your Primary Email Address
docs.text:
Your primary email is used for:

  • Logging into the system
  • Receiving password reset emails
  • Important account notifications
  • System correspondence

docs.title: Steps to Change Primary Email
docs.text:
1. Click My Account → Update email address
  2. Your current email displays in the "Current email address" field
  3. Enter your new email in the New email address field
  4. Click Continue
  5. If the email is available, you'll see a password confirmation section
  6. Enter your current password to authorize the change
  7. Click Update
  8. Result: "Email address has been changed to [new email]"

docs.title: What Happens Behind the Scenes
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    actor User
    participant System
    participant Database
    participant Email

    User->>System: Enter new email + Click Continue
    System->>System: Validate email format
    System->>Database: Check if email exists
    alt Email already in use
        System-->>User: Error: "Email already exists"
    else Email available
        System-->>User: Show password confirmation section
        User->>System: Enter current password + Click Update
        System->>System: Verify password
        alt Password incorrect
            System-->>User: Error: "Password is not correct"
        else Password correct
            System->>Database: Update email + rehash password
            System->>Email: Send confirmation to both old and new email
            Email-->>User: Confirmation email delivered
            System-->>User: "Email address has been changed"
            System->>System: Log the change
        end
    end

docs.title: Form Fields
docs.text:
Current email address

  • Shows your existing email (read-only)
  • Cannot be changed directly

New email address (required)

  • Enter your new email address
  • Must be in valid email format (example@domain.com)
  • Cannot be an email already used by another account

Continue button

  • Submits your new email address
  • Checks if the email is available
  • Shows password confirmation if available

Current Password (required when changing)

  • You must enter your current password to authorize the change
  • Required for security

Update button

  • Confirms the email change
  • Uses your password to update the system

docs.title: Email Format Rules
docs.text:
Your email must follow standard format:

Valid Examples:

  • firstname.lastname@company.com
  • user@gmail.com
  • first_last@organization.org

Invalid Examples:

  • notanemail ❌ (no @ symbol)
  • user @company.com ❌ (space in address)
  • missing@domain ❌ (no extension)

docs.title: Add or Update Secondary Email
docs.text: A secondary email receives the same notifications as your primary email but cannot be used for login.

docs.title: Add Secondary Email
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Update your secondary email address section
  2. Enter an email address in the field
  3. Click Save
  4. Result: "Secondary email address updated"

Note

Secondary email setup is immediate - no password or verification required.

docs.title: Remove Secondary Email
docs.text:
1. In the Update your secondary email address section, clear the field completely
  2. Click Save
  3. Result: Secondary email is removed from your account

docs.title: Secondary Email Rules
docs.text:
• Optional - you don't have to add one
  • Cannot be used for login
  • Receives duplicate notifications of your primary email
  • Must be in valid email format if you add one

docs.title: Error: "Email address already exists in the user database"
docs.text:
What This Means: Another account is already using this email address.

How to Fix: 1. Use a different email address 2. If you have multiple accounts, use separate emails for each 3. Contact your administrator if the email should be yours

docs.title: Error: "Not a valid email address"
docs.text:
What This Means: The email format is incorrect.

How to Fix: 1. Make sure your email has an @ symbol 2. Include the domain (gmail.com, company.org, etc.) 3. Check for typos 4. Don't include spaces

Format: firstname.lastname@example.com

docs.title: Error: "Existing password is not correct"
docs.text:
What This Means: The password you entered doesn't match your account password.

How to Fix: 1. Make sure Caps Lock is off 2. Re-enter your password carefully 3. Try again 4. If you forgot your password, click Forgot password to reset it before trying to change your email

docs.title: What Happens After You Change Your Email
docs.text:
After you successfully change your primary email:

  1. Confirmation emails are sent to both your old and new email addresses
  2. Next login - You can use your new email to log in
  3. Password reset emails will now go to your new address
  4. System notifications will go to your new email
  5. Your secondary email (if you have one) will still receive duplicate notifications

docs.title: Email Change Workflow Diagram
docs.text:
graph TD
    A["1. Go to<br/>My Account"] --> B["2. Click<br/>Update email"]
    B --> C["3. Enter new<br/>email address"]

    L --> M["Confirmation<br/>emails sent"]

docs.title: Will my account be locked during the change?
docs.text: No. You stay logged in the whole time. The change happens immediately after you verify your password.

docs.title: Can I use my new email to log in right away?
docs.text: Yes. After the change is complete, you can use your new email address to log in on your next visit.

docs.title: Do confirmation emails actually get sent?
docs.text: Yes. Your old email and new email both receive a confirmation that the change was made. This helps you know if someone else tried to change your email.

docs.title: What if I add a secondary email and then change my primary email?
docs.text: Your secondary email remains and continues to receive notifications. You can change either one at any time independently.

docs.title: Can I use the same email for primary and secondary?
docs.text: No. You cannot duplicate your primary email as a secondary email.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
Email Management:

  • ✅ Use an email address you check regularly
  • ✅ Keep your password secure (don't share it)
  • ✅ Update your email before old account closes
  • ✅ Remove secondary email if you stop using it

Security:

  • ✅ Remember your current password before changing email

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Manage your personal information, profile picture, contact details, and account preferences.

How to Access: Click My Account then Update Profile

docs.title: Page Sections
docs.text:
The Update Profile page is organised into several sections, each with a Save button. You can update one section or multiple sections - just click Save in each section you change.

  1. Profile Picture & Theme
  2. About Me
  3. Profile Details
  4. Email Notifications
  5. Address
  6. Phone Numbers
  7. Event Log

docs.title: How to Upload a Profile Picture
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Profile Picture section
  2. Click Upload Image or Choose File
  3. Select a photo from your computer
  4. Click Open
  5. The image uploads and displays immediately
  6. Confirmation: "Profile picture updated"

Image Requirements:

  • Formats: JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF
  • Size: Maximum 5 MB recommended
  • Dimensions: Square images work best (e.g., 400x400 pixels)

Tips:

  • ✅ Use a clear, professional photo
  • ✅ Crop to show your face clearly
  • ✅ Use good lighting
  • ✅ Keep file size reasonable for faster loading

docs.title: How to Remove Your Profile Picture
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Profile Picture section
  2. Click Remove Image or Delete
  3. Confirm the deletion when prompted
  4. Confirmation: Your picture is removed and replaced with a default avatar

docs.title: How to Change Your Theme
docs.text:
The theme changes the colour scheme and appearance of your interface.

  1. Scroll to the Theme Selection section
  2. Preview available themes (thumbnails shown)
  3. Click the theme you want
  4. Result: The interface changes immediately to your selected theme

Colour Schemes:

  • Preview the available colour schemes using thumbnails.
  • Names and exact colours may vary by configuration.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text: Share information about yourself that other members can see.

docs.title: How to Update Your About Me
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the About Me section
  2. Click in the text editor
  3. Type or paste your information
  4. Use the formatting toolbar to:
  5. Bold, Italic, or Underline text
  6. Add bullet points or numbered lists
  7. Insert links
  8. Change text alignment
  9. Click Save
  10. Confirmation: "About Me updated"

What to Include:

  • Your role or position
  • Experience or qualifications
  • Interests or specializations
  • Anything you'd like colleagues to know

Tips:

  • ✅ Keep it professional
  • ✅ Update regularly
  • ✅ Be concise (a few paragraphs)
  • ✅ Proofread before saving

docs.title: Profile Details
docs.text: Basic information about your role and preferences.

docs.title: Fields
docs.text:
Shirt Size

  • Select from dropdown (XS, S, M, L, XL, XXL, etc.)
  • Used for uniform ordering

Pants Size

  • Used for uniform ordering

Occupation

  • Your current job title or role

Joined Date

docs.title: How to Update Profile Details
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Profile Details section

  3. Click Save
  4. Confirmation: "Profile details saved"

docs.title: Email Notifications
docs.text:

Notification Preferences

docs.text:

docs.title: Address
docs.text: Your physical address for correspondence and records.

docs.title: How to Enter Your Address
docs.text: The system offers three address format options. Choose the one that matches your address type:

docs.title: Option 1: Standard Address (Most Common)
docs.text:
Use this for typical street addresses.

  1. Click the Standard Address radio button
  2. Fill in the fields:
  3. House/Unit Number - Street number (e.g., 123)
  4. Street Name - Name only without type (e.g., Main)
  5. Street Type - Select from dropdown (Street, Road, Avenue, etc.)
  6. Suburb - Your suburb or town
  7. State - Your state or province
  8. Postcode - Postal/ZIP code
  9. Country - Your country
  10. Click Save
  11. Confirmation: "Address updated"

Example:

House Number: 123
Street Name: Main
Street Type: Street
Suburb: Springfield
State: Victoria
Postcode: 3000
Country: Australia

docs.title: Option 2: Unit/Flat Address
docs.text:
Use this if you live in an apartment, unit, or flat.

  1. Click the Unit/Flat Address radio button
  2. Additional fields appear:
  3. Unit/Flat Number - Your unit/apartment number (e.g., 5A)
  4. Street Number - Building street number
  5. Street Name - Name of the street
  6. Street Type - Type from dropdown
  7. Suburb, State, Postcode, Country - As above
  8. Click Save

Example:

Unit Number: 5A
Street Number: 123
Street Name: Main
Street Type: Street
Suburb: Springfield
State: Victoria
Postcode: 3000
Country: Australia

docs.title: Option 3: PO Box
docs.text:
Use this if you have a Post Office Box.

  1. Click the PO Box radio button
  2. Fill in:
  3. PO Box Number - Your box number (e.g., 456)
  4. Suburb - Post office location
  5. State
  6. Postcode
  7. Country
  8. Click Save

Example:

PO Box: 456
Suburb: Springfield
State: Victoria
Postcode: 3000
Country: Australia

docs.title: Address Field Requirements
docs.text:
House/Street Number:

  • Can include letters (e.g., 123A, 5B)
  • Numbers and letters only
  • No special characters

Street Name:

  • Letters, spaces, and hyphens only
  • Don't include the street type here (use dropdown)

Street Type Dropdown: Includes 50+ options like:

  • Street, Road, Avenue, Drive, Lane
  • Court, Place, Crescent, Way
  • Terrace, Grove, Circuit, Boulevard
  • And many more

Suburb/State/Country:

  • Letters, spaces, and hyphens
  • Proper capitalization recommended

Postcode:

  • Numbers only (most countries)
  • Format depends on your country

docs.title: Phone Numbers
docs.text: Contact phone numbers where you can be reached.

docs.title: How to Update Phone Numbers
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Phone Numbers section
  2. Enter or update:
  3. Primary Phone - Main contact number
  4. Work Phone - Business number
  5. Secondary Phone - Additional/mobile number
  6. Click Save
  7. Confirmation: "Phone numbers updated"

Phone Number Format:

  • Can include: numbers, spaces, dashes, plus signs
  • Include country code for international numbers
  • Examples:
  • +61 3 9123 4567 (international)
  • (03) 9123 4567 (local)
  • 0412 345 678 (mobile)

Tips:

  • ✅ Include area code
  • ✅ Use consistent formatting
  • ✅ Add country code if international
  • ✅ Test your number after saving

docs.title: Event Log
docs.text:
View a history of your account activity and logins.

What the Event Log Shows:

  • Login times and dates
  • IP addresses of logins
  • Profile changes
  • Password changes
  • Email updates
  • Other account activity

docs.title: How to View Your Event Log
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the Event Log section
  2. Browse the list of recent events
  3. Use Previous/Next buttons to see older events
  4. Information shown:
  5. Date and time
  6. Action performed
  7. IP address (where applicable)
  8. Result (success/failure)

Why Check Your Event Log:

  • ✅ Verify your recent activity
  • ✅ Check for unauthorized access
  • ✅ Review when you last logged in
  • ✅ See history of profile changes

Security Tip: If you see logins you don't recognise, change your password immediately and contact an administrator.

docs.title: Account Deletion
docs.text: Warning: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.

docs.title: How to Delete Your Account
docs.text:
1. Scroll to the bottom of the page
  2. Click Delete Account button
  3. Warning message appears: "Are you sure you want to delete your account? This action cannot be undone."
  4. Confirm by clicking Yes, Delete My Account
  5. Your account is permanently removed

What Happens When You Delete:

  • All your personal information is removed
  • Your access to the system is revoked
  • Your profile is no longer visible to others
  • This action is permanent and cannot be reversed

Before Deleting:

  • ✅ Consider if you really want to leave
  • ✅ Download any important information
  • ✅ Inform administrators if required
  • ✅ Contact support if you're having issues instead

docs.title: Updating Multiple Sections at Once
docs.text:
1. Make changes to any section(s)
  2. Click Save in each section you changed
  3. Each section saves independently
  4. Confirmation: You'll see a success message for each section

docs.title: Checking Who Can See Your Information
docs.text:
Your profile information visibility depends on:

  • Your group's settings - Configured by administrators
  • System privacy rules - Set by the organisation
  • Your updates - Information you choose to provide

Generally Visible to Others:

  • Name
  • Profile picture
  • Email address (in directory)
  • Phone numbers (if shared in directory)

Private Information:

  • Password
  • Secret question/answer
  • Event log
  • Some personal details (based on configuration)

docs.title: Reviewing Your Recent Activity
docs.text:
1. Scroll to Event Log section
  2. Review dates and times of activities
  3. Look for unfamiliar logins or changes
  4. Report suspicious activity to an administrator

docs.title: Profile Picture Won't Upload
docs.text:
Possible Causes:

  • File too large
  • Wrong file format
  • Internet connection issue

How to Fix:

  1. Check file is JPG, PNG, or GIF
  2. Reduce image size if over 5 MB
  3. Try a different photo
  4. Check internet connection
  5. Try a different browser
  6. Contact support if problem persists

docs.title: Address Not Saving
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Make sure all required fields are filled
  2. Check House Number only contains numbers and letters
  3. Verify Street Name only has letters and hyphens
  4. Ensure you selected a Street Type from dropdown
  5. Check Postcode format is correct
  6. Try clicking Save again

docs.title: "Invalid phone number" Error
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Remove any letters from phone number
  2. Only use: numbers, spaces, dashes, and +
  3. Check format: (03) 9123 4567 or +61 3 9123 4567
  4. Don't use parentheses if it causes issues
  5. Remove any special characters

docs.title: Changes Not Appearing
docs.text:
What to Try:

  1. Refresh the page to see updates
  2. Log out and log back in
  3. Clear browser cache
  4. Try a different browser
  5. Contact support if changes consistently don't save

docs.title: Theme Won't Change
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Click directly on the theme thumbnail
  2. Wait a moment for the change to apply
  3. Refresh the page
  4. Clear browser cache
  5. Try selecting a different theme first, then your preferred one

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Group Reporting provides interactive dashboards and exports covering login activity, assessment volumes and outcomes, template-level metrics, exam performance, and observer engagement. Use date and subgroup filters to focus on specific cohorts and timeframes.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: • Sidebar: Group Reporting.

docs.title: Date Range
docs.text:
• Tick Specify a date range to enable.
  • Set Start and End dates; click Refresh.

docs.title: Subgroup and Role Filters
docs.text:
• Filter by Subgroup to isolate a team/region.
  • Filter by Role (User, Viewer, Reviewer, Owner) for role-specific insights.

docs.title: User Filter (Charts)
docs.text:
• Tick Report on specific user and choose a user from the dropdown.
  • Click Refresh (if needed) to update charts.

docs.title: Export This Data to CSV (Charts)
docs.text:
• Click Export this data to CSV to download the current tab's dataset.
  • CSV opens in Excel/Sheets for deeper analysis.

docs.title: Raw Data Export (Admin Only)
docs.text:
• Optionally tick Specify a date range for export.
  • Enter Start and End dates (export range).
  • Click Assessments or Plans to export raw CSV data.
  • Note: Exporting all data may take several minutes.

Tip

Use the User filter to focus on one member's activity. Keep chart date range aligned with your export window when comparing.

docs.title: Activity
docs.text:
• Logins Over Time: Line chart of daily/weekly logins.
  • Active Users: Count of distinct users active in range.
  • Return Rate: Users with multiple sessions vs. one-offs.
  • Last Login Table: Who signed in and when, including inactivity streaks.

Use this tab to monitor adoption and identify members who may need reminders or support.

docs.title: Per Template
docs.text:
Focus on template-specific performance (e.g., Diary, Match Day, Season):

  • Average Score: Mean rating per template in range.
  • Completion Rate: Completed vs. assigned.
  • Distribution: Histogram of ratings to spot skew/heaping.
  • Time to Complete: Median/average days from assignment to completion.

Filters:

  • Template type, assessor, subject, subgroup.

docs.title: Assessments
docs.text:
• Volume: Created/Submitted/Published counts.
  • Status Breakdown: Draft, In Review, Submitted, Published, Archived.
  • Completion Trend: Weekly completions vs. prior period.
  • Top Assessors/Subjects: Activity leaders.

Use this to clear backlogs and track throughput.

docs.title: Assessment Breakdown
docs.text:
Granular view into rubric categories across assessments:

  • Per-Category Averages: Identify strengths and gaps.
  • Variance: Spot inconsistent scoring.
  • Outliers: High/low scores for review or calibration.

Export for calibration sessions and training needs analysis.

docs.title: Exams
docs.text:
• Attempts: Number of users who started/completed.
  • Pass Rate: Pass/fail and average score.
  • Question Analysis: Most-missed questions and distractors (if available).
  • Cohort Comparison: By subgroup or role.

Drill into a specific exam via Admin: Exam Management.

docs.title: Observers
docs.text:
• Engagement: Number of reviews submitted per observer.
  • Timeliness: Average time to submit after event.
  • Coverage: Distribution across subgroups/events.

Use to support workload balancing and recognition.

docs.title: Export Group Assessments (Raw CSV)
docs.text:

  2. In Raw Data Export, tick Specify a date range (optional) and set dates.
  3. Click Assessments.
  4. Open the downloaded CSV in Excel or Sheets.

docs.title: Report on a Specific User

docs.title: Compare Templates Across Seasons

docs.text:

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
These background endpoints support core features such as forms security, session stability, uploads, and offline capabilities. They do not appear in the menu and are not directly accessed by users.

Administrator or developer context: reference only

docs.title: CAPTCHA Service
docs.text:
Provides human verification on selected forms to prevent automated abuse.

  • Where you see it: Registration or other public forms may include a CAPTCHA.
  • What it does: Validates that the submission is made by a real person.

docs.title: Keep Session Alive
docs.text:
Helps maintain your signed-in session during long periods of activity.

  • Where you see it: Transparent; triggered by pages that need to keep your session from expiring.
  • What it does: Periodically pings the server so you do not get logged out while working.

docs.title: Upload Handler
docs.text:
Securely processes file uploads from pages that support attaching files.

  • Where you see it: Admin areas and media/library pages that allow uploads.
  • What it does: Receives files and stores them according to your group’s configuration.

docs.title: Service Worker
docs.text:
Improves performance and resilience for static assets.

  • Where you see it: Transparent; the site may register a service worker to cache resources.
  • What it does: Caches assets for faster loads and supports limited offline behaviour.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Upload fails: Check your file size/type and try again on a stable connection.
  • Session expired unexpectedly: Sign in again and ensure your browser isn’t blocking background requests.
  • CAPTCHA not loading: Refresh the page; if it persists, try a different network.

docs.title: Recommended Browsers
docs.text:
Google Chrome (recommended)

  • Current version
  • Best overall performance and compatibility
  • Required for optimal features

Microsoft Edge (recommended)

  • Current version
  • Full feature support
  • Good performance

docs.title: JavaScript Required
docs.text:
JavaScript must be enabled in your browser to use the Match Official System. The system relies heavily on JavaScript for interactive features including:

  • Assessments and form submissions
  • Real-time data updates
  • File uploads and downloads
  • Dynamic content loading
  • Auto-save functionality
  • Media browsing and viewing
  • Rich text editing

If you see a blank page or error messages: Check that JavaScript is enabled in your browser settings.

docs.title: Browser Compatibility
docs.text:
While other browsers may work, Chrome and Edge provide the best experience. If you experience issues with another browser, try one of the recommended options above.

Supported JavaScript versions: ES6+

docs.title: Hardware Requirements
docs.text:
• Processor: Any modern processor (Intel/AMD)
  • RAM: Minimum 1 GB (4 GB recommended)
  • Storage: Minimal; files are stored in the cloud
  • Internet Connection: Broadband recommended (minimum 1 Mbps for file uploads)

docs.title: Mobile Devices
docs.text:
The system is optimized for desktop and tablet use. Mobile phone access is supported but may have limited functionality depending on screen size.

For best mobile experience:

  • Use a tablet (iPad, Android tablet) when possible
  • Use landscape orientation on some pages.
  • Consider switching to a desktop browser for complex assessments

docs.title: Network Requirements
docs.text:
• Internet connection: Required (broadband recommended)
  • Firewall: May need to whitelist matchofficialsystem.com
  • Proxy servers: May require configuration in some corporate networks
  • Cookie support: Must be enabled in your browser

docs.title: Accessibility
docs.text:
The system supports:

  • Screen reader compatible pages
  • Keyboard navigation
  • High contrast modes
  • Font size adjustment (browser zoom)
  • Mobile and tablet layouts

For accessibility assistance: Contact your administrator or see FAQ

docs.title: Blank page or won't load
docs.text:
1. Clear browser cache and cookies
  2. Disable browser extensions temporarily
  3. Try a different browser
  4. Check your internet connection
  5. Contact your administrator if the problem persists

docs.title: Slow performance
docs.text:
1. Close other browser tabs and applications
  2. Clear browser cache
  3. Try upgrading your internet connection
  4. Use a wired connection instead of WiFi if possible

docs.title: Features not working
docs.text:
1. Ensure JavaScript is enabled
  2. Update your browser to the latest version
  3. Disable browser extensions temporarily
  4. Try in a private/incognito browsing window
  5. Try a different browser

docs.title: Large file uploads failing
docs.text:
1. Check your internet connection
  2. Use a wired connection instead of WiFi
  3. Reduce file size if possible
  4. Try uploading during off-peak hours
  5. Contact your administrator for large file options

docs.title: Data Storage and Privacy
docs.text:
• All data is stored in secure cloud servers in Microsoft Azure (Australia Southeast region)
  • Requires internet connection to access
  • Files stored in Azure Blob Storage
  • Database hosted on SQL Server
  • Data residency in Australia Southeast ensures compliance with local data storage requirements
  • No data is stored locally on your computer

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you're unable to meet system requirements or need assistance:

  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Contact your Match Official System administrator
  • Check Troubleshooting for error messages
